results.description:
It is important for us as students of spirituality and mysticism to become aware and acquainted with the tremendous resources that are available to us to make our lives more harmonious.

Once we learn to tap these inner resources, living will be an invigorating affair continuing and picking up where we left off in previous life experiences and thereby advancing and expanding the consciousness.

We need to keep foremost in our consciousness certain principles, conditions and laws to gain access to spiritual tools and to arrive at permanent solutions to life's challenges.

Through lectures, participation in meditation, and visualization exercises, we will be given the opportunity to experience the value of discussing these principles in a group setting.

Facilitating the discussions will be Dr. Lonnie Edwards, Vice President of the EGL Board of Directors, and author of Spiritual Laws that Govern Humanity and the Universe.

(www.facebook.com/Spiritual.Laws)
results.name: Discuss Spiritual Laws with Dr. Lonnie Edwards

results.description:
April 16th.  Day after Tax Day!  Lets spend that Refund together when we go back to the Bronx for Part 3.  First we head to the Botanical Gardens next to the Bronx Zoo.  An All-Garden Pass for Adults is $25.  I noted the Orchid Show is on through April 17th among other exhibits.  Its the 125th Anniversary of the Gardens this year.  Then we will walk a few blocks over to Arthur Ave.  Our dinner reservation at the Foodie Fav Antonio's Trattoria is at 5:30 PM. 


You can certainly choose one or the other.  I wouldn't skip the dinner though!   There are many shops on Arthur Ave and surrounding streets to purchase Italian cheese, pastas, wines, etc. in what many view as the REAL Little Italy!  Bring cash as some of the old school shopkeepers may not take credit cards.


Botanical Gardens | 2900 Southern Blvd | Bronx NY | http://www.nybg.org/visit/

Hours are 10AM - 6PM

Antonio's Trattoria | 2370 Belmont Ave | Bronx NY | http://www.antoniostrattoria.com/main.htm

results.description:
350NYC Climate Education Group presents: "Cowspiracy".
This is a controversial movie in that it is highly critical of the climate movement. Please join us for this screening and discussion as we talk about what we should or could do differently.

About the Film

Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret is a groundbreaking feature-length environmental documentary following intrepid filmmaker Kip Andersen as he uncovers the most destructive industry facing the planet today – and investigates why the world’s leading environmental organizations are too afraid to talk about it.

Animal agriculture is the leading cause of deforestation, water consumption and pollution, is responsible for more greenhouse gases than the transportation industry, and is a primary driver of rainforest destruction, species extinction, habitat loss, topsoil erosion, ocean “dead zones,” and virtually every other environmental ill. Yet it goes on, almost entirely unchallenged.

As Andersen approaches leaders in the environmental movement, he increasingly uncovers what appears to be an intentional refusal to discuss the issue of animal agriculture, while industry whistleblowers and watchdogs warn him of the risks to his freedom and even his life if he dares to persist.

As eye-opening as Blackfish and as inspiring as An Inconvenient Truth, this shocking yet humorous documentary reveals the absolutely devastating environmental impact large-scale factory farming has on our planet, and offers a path to global sustainability for a growing population.

SPEAKER
We are thrilled to welcome Timothy Pakron a.k.a. Mississippi Vegan to discuss vegan lifestyle and the climate impacts of the consumption of animal products. Tim describes himself as a NYC Artist | Chef | Forager | and makes his living combining his artistic and culinary skills with a major social media presence. Find out more at his web site and come on down to Patagonia to hear him in person on Saturday.
http://www.mississippivegan.com/about-me/


RSVP on this Meetup OR on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/events/995161997233004/
results.name: "COWSPIRACY" - Film Screening and Discussion

This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

Do you see the same numbers (11:11, 333, 937, etc.) again and again?
Do you KNOW there’s more than what you can perceive with your 5 senses?
Do you feel like you have a connection to passed over loved ones, the Angels and beyond?

Spirit is communicating with us all the time, we just need to honor and recognize these signs and such “coincidences”. Come to this workshop hosted by Reiki Master Teacher Karen Foote where we will be enlightened to the many ways that Spirit is connecting with us! It’s like flipping a switch or adjusting a dial to realize that these messages are all around us all the time. Gathering with likeminded people with similar experiences can be very validating, empowering and enlightening! Recognizing these signs is truly special and keeps the bonds alive over space and time. Come with questions or with stories to share! It will be a wonderful day of shared experiences as well as a way to gain some tips and tools in order to be more consciously connected with the Spirit world. Please RSVP at www.livefree4life.com

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

results.description:
*Thanks to member Mary Beth for suggesting this idea*

Let's form as part of this membership group a book club. Books will follow a theme of one or more of the following:

Irish genealogy and/or history
British genealogy and/or history
Scottish genealogy and/or history
Welsh genealogy and/or genealogy
Fiction or nonfiction All members may recommend books to include in future book club sessions. Please send me a message or post to the meetup for review.

The inaugural book club will focus on the book Easter Widows by Sinead McCoole. It tells the story of seven widows that lived in the shadow of the 1916 Easter Rising. I'm sure everyone can figure out why I selected the themed book (!) and thought Apr 16.16. seemed a suitable day to set it up.

I will post venue details shortly.

This book is available through various means of which a number may require overseas delivery. I ordered mine from OMahonys booksellers (www.omahonys.ie) as have purchased from them before and can vouch for their timely and efficient process. However you may have your own option / more optimal pricing.

I will propose the following format as a starting point and upon feedback can adjust / enhance:

1. Quick Poll (1 MIN) Going round group everyone offers their "star" rating from 1-5.
2. Discussion Points. (30MIN) Book selector (or may nominate someone to do) comes prepared with 3 key questions on book to encourage discussion. Members of group are invited to contribute comments, feedback.
3. Other Points (up to 10MIN). Open discussion, other points or questions members may raise / share.

Wrap up of book review and opportunity to connect with others.

Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Will be on 2nd floor on right hand side.
results.name: BOOK CLUB: Easter Widows by Sinead McCoole

What does connection really mean?

How do you connect with yourself and with others?

What is a relationship? What does it mean to be yourself in relationships?

Are there ways to improve the way you connect, so you feel accepted and free, without having to pretend you are someone you are not?

We will explore these powerful questions through a conversation about the ways we connect in our current relationships and through experiential relational practices.


Together we will explore new ways that reveal what’s possible in terms of depth, fulfillment, presence and love in connection.

The topics will include:

1. How to develop a powerful sense of self-connection so you feel present, alive, grounded and whole.


2. How to be aware of your needs and desires so you know how to navigate your own life and relationships skillfully and avoid misunderstandings.

3. How to bring your presence into connection with others so your relationships have a quality of spontaneity, realness and magic.

4. How to appreciate and welcome others deeply for who they are.

5. How being yourself contributes to all your relationships and can help you and others grow.

In this evening you will learn about yourself, meet and connect with others in meaningful ways, and cultivate a sense of nourishment and presence to apply in your every day life.

There will be snacks, time to mingle, and an opportunity to explore the relational work offered in a deeper way.

There is an already thriving community of people committed to being authentic, bringing forward their true self, and creating amazing relationships.


Come join it!

Gina & Noah

*No previous experience necessary. Will receive address upon RSVP. Doors will be closed at 2:00 to ensure a complete experience for everyone, so please arrive with enough time to settle in comfortably.
results.name: Creating amazing relationships, a conversation and experience.

results.description:
THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals.

DISCOVER ARCHITECTURAL GEMS OF THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT ON OUT PROFESSIONALS’ NEWEST WALKING TOUR AND MIXER.

On Saturday, April 16, the Members of OP.LYNX, Out Professionals’ dynamic women’s network, invite you to begin a memorable trip through time at Bowling Green, the oldest public park in New York City, still surrounded by its original 18th-century fence.

Here, where Native American tribes had gathered in council, thousands marched in support of labor rights, women agitated for the vote, John D. Rockefeller ran an oil empire, and people booked transatlantic passage on the steamships of the Cunard Line.

“Historic Bowling Green: The Walking Tour and Mixer” captures New York City’s role in the late 19th and early 20th centuries as the center of ocean travel, trade and commerce, world-transforming inventions, and political activism.

On Out Professionals’ first walking tour of spring you encounter styles ranging from neo-Renaissance splendor to Art Deco pizzazz, and view gorgeous mosaics and other decorative elements that are both perfect symbols of their times and enduring works of art. Afterwards, kick back and relax with new friends at Ulysses’ Folk House, a welcoming nearby watering hole.

This private walking tour/mixer has been designed for us — and you — by journalist Susan DeMark, the creator of Mindful Walker, a project that focuses on the experience of architecture, history, street life and nature. You’ll gain not only a renewed appreciation of this storied part of New York but also a heightened sense of the works of art in our midst each day.

Tour highlights include:

• The site where seven suffragists took their cause to the Financial District in 1908, only to be confronted by New York City police.

• The Broadway building where hundreds of family and friends congregated to learn the fate of the passengers on the Titanic.

• The astonishing sculptures, architectural motifs and murals that document the area’s history as Steamship Row.

• An Art Deco skyscraper built in the depths of the Depression that earned local craftsmen awards for its dazzling mosaics and sculpture.

WHAT’S UP

On Saturday, April 16, “Historic Bowling Green: The Walking Tour and Mixer” begins at 2 p.m. sharp, rain or shine. Afterwards, network and socialize at Ulysses’ Folk House, 95 Pearl Street; refreshments on your own.

WHERE

We meet at 1:45 p.m. (not a minute later!) at the northwest corner of Broadway and Battery Place, in front of Citibank at 1 Broadway. Subway: R to Whitehall Street; 1 to South Ferry; 4 to Bowling Green/Broadway. Bus: M5 to South Ferry.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $25. Dues-paying OP Member, just $15. Advance registration closes at 11 p.m. on Friday, April 15. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! Best to order now: The personalized nature of our tours requires us to limit the number of participants. At the door, if available, cash only.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

Founded to increase and diversify OP membership and create programming of special interest to lesbian, bisexual and transgender women, OP.LYNX invites you to consider the many benefits of membership in the nation’s leading LGBT networking organization. A 12-month Individual Membership in Out Professionals (new or renewal) PLUS admission for one to “Historic Bowling Green: The Walking Tour and Mixer” is yours for just $75. And remember, this buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Explore Bowling Green!

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>

results.description:
We've been invited to join the Morbid Anatomy Museum to celebrate Obscura Day 2016! We don’t like to think about it, or perhaps we do, but death is an integral part of life and should be honored through storytelling. Did you preserve the frog you dissected in high school in a jar, much to your mother’s dismay? Or did you save your only child’s very first baby tooth? Or after your father died, did you find your grandmother’s art deco jewelry box in the back of a closet with a lock of his hair from his first baby hair cut? Or maybe you have a child’s urn--with the remains of your first dog--who your parents insisted on cremating rather than burying in the back yard? So bring your bones, feathers, teeth, ashes, locks of hair, hair art, body parts preserved in a jar, death-related art, cremation jewelry or urns and share their story. . .Every Thing (death and life-related) has a story.

Show & Tale is like Antiques Roadshow meets The Moth, or your favorite Pinterest board come to life!
Everyone is welcome to share with a 3 minute time limit. No judges, no prizes, no competition. And no need to practice! Just Show your object and share its Tale. Remember you don’t have to show and tell. . .you can just look and listen; observers are always welcome!
results.name: Obscura Day 2016 S&T: Morbid Anatomy

We get together every other weekend and play jazz.

If you plan to join the group, the most important thing you can tell us is what instrument you play. 

Please check the RSVP list for any jam session before you sign up. If we already have several guitarists and keyboardists, as well as a bassist and drummer, then we don't need any more of those players. Sign up for the next one. 

These jams aren't for beginners. You should have some proficiency on your instrument, although you may be relatively new to jazz. We try to provide a place where musicians can come together and develop their skills as jazz players and play to the best of their ability. Toward that end, we will not tolerate anyone who criticizes another's playing.

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition) to the sessions. Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a song that's not in the book, you must bring lead sheets for everyone.

We'll be in one of the rooms at Music Makers, on the third floor. The address and directions are above. I'll usually let everyone know by Thursday which room we'll be in on Saturday. The rooms cost $72 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.

results.description:
Do you love sweets? snacks? beer and wine? Would you like to enjoy all of the above while helping to transform the lives of disadvantaged and at-risk youth who might just become the next generation of amazing chefs and restauranteurs? 

We invite you to The Promise Society's Second Annual Brews, Bites and Wines Charity Tasting. Join us for an event filled with sweet bites and desserts from local artisan bakers and sweet makers, craft beers from local breweries and delicious samples of wine. As a collaboration with the Queens International Night Market, some of our treat vendors will also be featured at their upcoming night market. 

VIP bracelets are available for access to liquor samples. Early bird tickets are available for 20% off the general admission ticket. At the door, general tasting tickets will be $60 and VIP bracelets will be $30, so save money and get your tickets in advance! Get your tickets here:


http://tpsbrewsbiteswines2016.eventbrite.com/?aff=meetup2

We will have 20+ vendors for tastings, here are a sample of our participating sponsors: Bouchon Bakery (Small Bites) Koi Bryant Park (Savory Bites) Chinatown Ice Cream Factory (Ice Cream) Insomnia Cookies (Cookies) Kulu Desserts (Puddings) NYC's Best Dressed Cupcakes (Cupcakes) Squish Marshmellows (Custom Marshmellow Treats) Tasty Theater (Gelee) Three Little Woos (Macaroons) Yumpling (Cake) Allagash (Beer) Ommegang (Beer) Bronx Brewery (Beer) Cloud No 9 (Wine) Red Hook Wine (Wine) Tanteo Tequila (Tequila) And more! In keeping with our commitment to education and social causes, The Promise Society is proud to host this event to raise funds and awareness for the Careers through Culinary Arts Program (C-CAP). 

C-CAP is a curriculum enrichment program linking public high school culinary teachers and their students to the food service industry. Their materials and services help prepare students for college and careers in the restaurant and hospitality industry. Based in New York City, C-CAP’s recipe for success includes teacher training, product donations, cooking competitions, college advising, college 101, scholarships, job training, internships and lifetime career guidance. “Careers through Culinary Arts Program’s mission is to promote and provide career opportunities in the foodservice industry for underserved youth through culinary arts education and employment.” Interested In Participating As A Vendor? Email us at [masked]! 

FAQs 

* Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 

Entrance requirements: This event is 21+. All guests must arrive before 5pm. After 5pm, access will be limited and is not guaranteed. 

 *Is my registration/ticket transferrable? 

Transferring Tickets: Your ticket is transferrable up to 72 hours prior to the event. Please make sure to update the name on the Eventbrite registration. 

*What is your refund policy? 

Refund Policy: Subject to the cancellation policy, all ticket sales and all sales at the Event are final and refunds will not be issued. In making a ticket purchase, the Participant understands that the list of sponsors and affiliates for the Event is subject to change and The Promise Society does not guarantee the participation of any particular sponsor. 

* Can I buy tickets at the door? Limited tickets may be available on the day of the event but will be priced at $60 for a General Tasting ticket and $90 for the VIP Tasting ticket ($60+$30 Add-on). Those with pre-paid General Tasting tickets can purchase the VIP Add-on at $30 on the day of the event.
results.name: The Promise Society 2nd Annual Brews, Bites and Wines Charity Tasting

RSVPs will open two weeks before day of meetup.  Priority on the waitlist will be given to individuals who have previously contributed to good discussion, posted a thoughtful comment or suggested an article.

This month's topic is drugs. Is addiction a public health problem and is it worse than ever? What should US government policy be to address it? How is narco trafficking affecting the US relationship with its neighbors? What has changed in the past decades about  the trade? results.description:
At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


Session 1 (Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay by Debit or Credit using Venmo to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 3/19/16; 3/26/16 (No Lesson); 4/2/16; 4/9/16; 4/16/16; 4/23/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. (Session 2 will progress members)

In 4 short months we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315 (Call for more details)

results.description:
We are offering a limited series of meetups to discuss the basics of being a professional writer, "The Business of Writing." This first session will be devoted to querying as it applies to fiction of all lengths from flash to novels. We will cover questions like:

• Do I need an agent?

• When should I self-publish, and how do I query after that?

• How do you decide where to send your queries/submissions?

• What should go in the cover letter?

• What should be in the synopsis?

• What length of sample should I prepare?

• How soon should I follow up on a submission, if at all?

• What happens to my query after I send it, and what can I expect in response?

We will have on hand new and veteran authors and acquisitions editors as well as some with self-publishing success to give you first-hand information about the process. Feel free to bring a synopsis or query letter you would like feedback on.

And in August, watch for an Expert Meetup with Ellen Datlow, a professional author who has been on both sides of the editor-author transaction (http://ellendatlow.com/bio/).
results.name: The Business of Writing: Querying

This meeting is for both fiction and non-fiction writers. Depending on how many people sign up to come and to share their work at this meeting, we will divide the group into two tables. A "fiction writers" table and a "non-fiction writers" table.

Bring a piece to read and discuss, up to 1500 words, or simply bring yourself. If you bring a piece, please make copies for the others. How many copies? Check here the last day and you will find the answer.

All formats welcome: poems, short stories, flash fiction, novellas, novels, articles, blog entries, essays, children books, screen and theatrical plays, etc.

Here is how we will divide the tables if needed:

1) Fiction writers: Genres covered are literary/upscale/art fiction, poetry, all kinds of mysteries, speculative fiction (fantasy, urban fantasy, horror and sci-fi), chick lit, women fiction, romance (all kinds, including historical, regent, sexy and erotica), western.

2) Non-fiction writers: Genres covered are all kids of non-fiction, autobiographies and memoires, academic non-fiction, news articles, blogs, poetry, non-fiction screenplays etc.

results.description:
Click Here for a Free Online Webinar: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation- 

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya (Free Online Webinar)

results.description:
You've probably seen Roosevelt Island many times, either from Queens or the Manhattan side, with lots of East River in between.

But have you been on the Island itself? 

Roosevelt Island has great vistas of Manhattan just across the East River - you can see from the area of the United Nations to way up the Upper East Side and beyond. 

In addition, there are picturesque walking paths as well as the kind of old ruins we photographers love. There's the Franklin D. Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park as well as The Octagon, an 1834 building that originally served as the main entrance to the New York Lunatic Assylum.

We'll get to the Island via the Roosevelt Island Tram. It's a five-minute ride in an honest-to-goodness Alpine gondola, and it will only cost you one Metrocard fare each way. The tram runs parallel to and quite close to the Queensboro Bridge, and you may  be able to get some good shots,  like the one by J. S. Park above, depending on how crowded the gondola is and how quick you are with your camera. 

We'll join up at 3:15 pm at the Manhattan station of the Roosevelt Island Tram, located on 2nd Ave between 59th and 60th Streets. You should arrive there with a Metrocard that has at least 2 fares on it. 


photo by J. S. Park, used under Creative Commons License
results.name: *** FREE EVENT *** Take the Tram to Roosevelt Island!

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

Please join us for this week's sit at 4pm this afternoon at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair), where a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice.  


The sit leaders alternate each week.  


We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com
results.name: Shabbat Meditation

results.description:
Looking to transition soon from meetup so follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/

Today I thought I'd change it up from the weekly group themes and instead do a fun challenge I call the 'Imaginative Illustrators Grab Bag Challenge!'. In this activity we will each write down on a piece of paper an idea to draw and mix everyone's ideas into a bag. Then each member will randomly and blindly choose from the bag until they get an idea that isn't their own and challenge themselves to draw it. 

The meetup will be split into three parts: First a half hour of warm-up drawing and brainstorming followed by a break of conceptual discussion, then after that an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others fully developed drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that may help out.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Imaginative Illustrators Grab Bag Challenge!

results.description:
Brazilian member Juliana has inspired us to branch out to authors who aren't American or European. Clarice Lispector was a Brazilian writer who has been described as possibly the most important Jewish writer since Franz Kafka. Acclaimed internationally for her innovative novels and short stories, she was also a journalist. Because they are so short, we are going to tackle two of her most critically acclaimed novels: The Passion According to G.H. (220 pages), and The Hour of the Star (120 pages). 

The Passion According to G.H. was published in 1964 and is considered one of the most important works of Brazilian fiction. It is a mystical novel that takes the form of a monologue by a woman, identified only as G.H., telling of the crisis that ensued the previous day after she crushed a cockroach in the door of a wardrobe. Its canonical status was recognized in 1988 by its inclusion in the Arquivos Collection, the UNESCO series of critical editions of the greatest works of Latin American literature. It has been translated into English twice, the first time in 1988, and then again in 2012. 

The Hour of the Star is Lispector's last novel, published in 1977 shortly after her death. It has been described as "philosophical fiction." It deals with the problems of the rural Northeast versus the urban Southeast, poverty and the dream of a better life, and, of an uneducated woman’s struggle to survive in a sexist society. This novel, too, has been translated into English twice, first in 1992, and then again in 2011.

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George, Priyo, & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

(photo of atrium and location of meetup table)

(photo of atrium entrance at the corner of 53rd and Lex.)


At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

Sammy Social is a member of several social groups in the city.  One particular day Sammy attended several events, met with friends and toured some historic sites near Herald Square.  By the end of the night Sammy met a horrible fate and the police need your help to solve this case!   Join us for this fun night where you will join with other members of our group to set out on a mission to find clues to solve Sammy's case. Along the way you will learn amazing bits and pieces of NYC history that you probably never knew.  The best part is that at the end of the hunt you can socialize with all the teams to talk about your adventure!

How it works:

-Arrive at The bar for socializing, cocktails and registration.

-If you don't have a team we will put you with other fun people in teams of 4-5.

-Once you are on a team you will receive a sheet retracing Sammy's steps that day.  You will go out into the neighborhood to find clues and fact that will help you solve Sammy's Case.  Along the way you will also learn a little NYC history!

-Each group will have 90 minutes to find as many clues and solve the case.  You will return to The bar for more socializing, cocktails and food if you wish, while we tally up the scores.

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code?  Be comfortable but keep it neat.

What will we be looking for?  You will be directed to several historic sights and places from Penn Station to 5th avenue, 32nd street to 35th street.  You will need to give us details on what you see and find.  It is actually pretty easy and fun!

What is included?  $10 includes admission to the hunt and drink specials at the bar.
results.name: The Great Midtown Murder Mystery Scavenger Hunt and Party

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!
results.name: Indoor bball warm up & pickup games

results.description:
This Saturday will be split into 2 halves to help A/B players who have played the game a bit run some new passing, dribbling and strategy drills. Then the other half of the session will utilize those drills in mixed A/B player games as we usually do on Wednesday's and Sunday's.

5pm: Pool and gear set up - please come help so we can get in the pool before 5:30pm!

5:30pm-7pm: Training

================

Learn how to “screen” and how to create spaces for your team-mates to shoot on goal, learn how to capitalize on a corner throw, along with a few other helpful skills, team and game tactics for offense and defense ... to get you playing better both individually and as a team.

7pm-8:30pm: Friendly Games

======================

Let’s try to put the drills into practice in some friendly games. We will also use the games to explain the basic rules for safe and happy play.


This session is intended for everyone who has been to and played in any of our sessions, and specifically targeted at our newer players. (If you are completely new to kayak polo and don't have experience kayaking with a skirt, rolling or doing a wet exit, please attend one of our Introduction Sessions first.)


Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo).
results.name: Saturday Training & Games Session

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.name: Yogic Breathing for Deep Stress Relief

results.description:
A fun afternoon of scrapbooking. I can host up to 6 people at the Crafty Game Cave nice and cozy.  With streaming Youtube videos all night long to get the creative juices flowing.

As a Stampin Up Demonstrator you are more than welcome to try out products from my stash.  Maybe you will use something you just gotta buy one for yourself ;)

Also on hand are the Cricut Expression (bring your mats & cartridges), a few Big Shot(s) and Martha Stewart scoreboards.  So bring your dies and embossing folders.

* I will have some beverages on hand! (Water, Soda, Juice we can make coffee or tea)  You are more than welcome to bring snacks if you please.  I have a microwave and a fridge at your disposal.  We are also local to many take out/delivery restaurants for food if you feel like ordering  I have some menus for your options.

Great, well cannot wait for some crafty company :)
results.name: Scrapbooking Afternoon Social...Weekend Edition!

results.description:
Ocho apellidos vascos (Spanish Affair, 2014) is an enticing comedy that contains emotion, humor, amusement and lots of jokes and laughs. This is indeed a very funny Spanish comedy with good acting by all the leads, a solid script boasting plenty of amusing situations and dialogues and some beautiful shots of both País Vasco (Basque Country) and Andalucía (Andalusia). Funny comedy with romantic touches here and there and in which humor and entertainment are well guaranteed .


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ADQD_Zt7qpI

All our movie events are with our own projector, large screen & sound system. 


EVENT GOOD FOR ALL LEVELS OF SPANISH - 

EVENT SCHEDULE - Saturday, April 16th, 2016

5:15 pm: Door opens. Meet others and practice your Spanish!
5:45 pm: A brief intro to the movie - Movie starts
7:10 pm: Movie ends - Short commentary - Stay and meet others!
7:30 pm: Event officially ends 

In Spanish, with good English subtitles - Event is Good for ALL levels

SYNOPSIS


The story deals when Rafael, (Dani Rovira) a Seville citizen who has never left the Spanish region of Andalucia, decides to leave his homeland to follow Amaia (Clara Lago), a Basque girl unlike other women he has known. He becomes involved in peculiar situations when he goes to vascongadas (Basque province) and meets his love but also her peculiar father (Kara Errejalde) and a middle aged lady from Caceres (Carmen Machi).


TECHNICAL INFORMATION

Director: Emilio Martínez Lázaro (as Emilio Martínez-Lázaro)

Writers: Borja Cobeaga, Diego San José

Stars: Clara Lago, Dani Rovira, Carmen Machi |


Spain, 2014

IN SPANISH, WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES

COST $6 in advance. $10 at the door (if space is available)

Please remember that simply click as "YES" does NOT reserve a spot, only advance payment does. This goes for all our events


¡Allá nos vemos!


Jorge

results.description:
Ladies, are you feeling a lull in your literary life? Just can't seem to find the right read? Thinking about branching out into different genres? Then join your fellow geek girls for a book exchange! 

Here's how it works: Pick a book you own (in good condition, please), wrap it up in something fun (gift wrap, newspaper, paper bag, etc.), and write your review/recommendation in a card for the lucky gal who gets to take your book home. 

Guidelines: Good condition means no pages missing, binding not falling apart, notes and coffee stains are OK. Let's start with only fiction books this time, please no series! Standalone novels only. 

P.S. - If you really can't bear to part with any of your books (just to be clear - it's an exchange and you won't be getting your book back), you can buy one. But we like to do it this way to save some cash and get to know new people based on their bookshelves. 

Though the event starts at 5:30, we'll mingle for a while before we start the exchange to give everyone a chance to get there. But please try to be punctual anyway :) If you're running late, please send me a message.
results.name: Book Exchange Party!

results.description:
In search of a miracle, an American woman embarks on a journey to the Peruvian Amazon and finds hope in a community, through rituals involving an ancient psychedelic plant known as ayahuasca. With her perception forever altered, she forges a bond with a young indigenous shaman undergoing a crisis of his own, and a motley crew of psychonauts seeking transcendence, companionship, and the meaning of life and death.


Filmmakers Leonor Caraballo and Matteo Norzi have deftly handled this drama by drawing from their own experiences, allowing for a uniquely stirring film that touches on the notions of friendship, familial bonds, and the fear of the unknown. Visually inventive and hypnotic in nature, Icaros: A Vision captivates with its meditative look at a little-seen world, punctuated by truly trippy depictions of ceremonial splendor.

—Loren Hammonds
FILM INFORMATION

Section: International Narrative Competition
Year: 2016
Length: 85 minutes
Language: English, Spanish
Country: USA, Peru
Premiere: World

CAST & CREDITS

Director: Leonor Caraballo, Matteo Norzi
Screenwriter: Leonor Caraballo, Matteo Norzi, Abou Farman
Producer: Abou Farman
Editor: Èlia Gasull Balada
Cinematographer: Ghasem Ebrahimian
Co-Producer: Adella Ladjevardi
2d Animator: Sara Gunnarsdóttir
Production Manager Peru: Enid "Pinky" Campos Leon
Sound Design and Mix: Tom Paul
Cast: Ana Cecilia Stieglitz, Arturo Izquierdo, Filippo Timi


ABOUT THE DIRECTOR(S)

Leonor Caraballo worked as a photographer and video artist between Buenos Aires and New York. She traveled to the Amazon where she was introduced to shamanism as practiced by Shipibo-Conibo communities. Matteo Norzi is a visual artist from Uruguay and Italy, living in New York. His explorative artistic practice has taken him on extensive journeys through six continents. Icaros: A Vision is their first feature.

https://tribecafilm.com/filmguide/icaros-a-vision-2016
results.name: Let's go see Icaros: A Vision

results.description: The treasury of Citadel Sundahar was looted and the heroes were hired to investigate who and how this was accomplished The heroes fought their way through the Underdark and pieced together what happened. 1) The villains appear to have burrowed into the vaults with a mining construct starting from existing caves in the Underdark. 2) The foot soldiers that broke into the vault seem to be a group of extraordinarily lethal and sentient constructs. 3) There is only a small number of organizations in Faerun with magic powerful enough to plan such a complex operation. 4) The party suspects there may be an inside connection from Silverymoon who betrayed a confidence. Is a senior member of the Spellguard plotting against their Sundahar allies? Are these events connected to the Orc infestation in Silver Marches? The heroes earned 775XP each for the game, 6 gp each, fungal spores that may be valuable for alchemists and they are also owed payment of 125gp each from the Sundahar leadership once they share the intelligence they have gathered. This campaign is now closed to new players as there is a core group of players I am reserving seats for in future sessions.

results.description:
We are happy to announce that at 5:30 p.m. on Saturday, April 16, His Holiness Krishna Kshetra Swami will give class and lead kirtans at our weekly program at 26 2nd Avenue. Krishna Kshetra Swami received initiation from His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, Founder Acarya of International Society of Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) in 1972. In 1987 Krishna Kshetra Swami was appointed as an initiating spiritual master (guru) of ISKCON. From 1991 to 1994 he was appointed as ISKCON's deity worship monitor. In 1994 he compiled a handbook for deity worship, Pancaratra Pradipa, in order to establish a standard of worship in ISKCON temples. From 1991 to 1995 he helped developed the Vaisnava Library at the Gurukula school in Mayapur. During the '90s, Krishna Kshetra Swami travelled around Europe sharing Krishna consciousness and inspiring devotees in different temples. The highlight of his travels were many concerts performed by the Gauranga Bhajan Band, often before audiences as large as 10,000. Krishna Kshetra Swami was a lead singer of ecstatic kirtans in the Gauranga Bhajan Band.

In recent years, wishing to help develop systematic education within ISKCON, he earned a Ph.D. in Religious Studies at Oxford University and has taught at the University of Florida and Chinese University of Hong Kong. He is currently the Dean of Studies at Bhaktivedanta College, Radhadesh, and a permanent Research Fellow of the Oxford Centre for Hindu Studies.

Together with Radhikaramana das, he has edited “The Bhagavata Purana: Sacred Text and Living Tradition” (Columbia University Press). Together they are now preparing an abridged Srimad Bhagavatam with the same publisher.

Krishna Kshetra Swami is now based in Oxford, U.K., and in Radhadesh, Belgium. On August 17, 2014, he accepted the sannyasa order of life (lifetime commitment as a renunciate). This is a link to his website: http://ww.krks.name/

A photo of our special guest His Holiness Krishna Kshetra Swami from when he gave class at 26 2nd Avenue in 2013 can be viewed here:   http://www.meetup.com/Kirtan-and-Discourses-on-Bhagavad-Gita/photos/19158462/#[masked] During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   


Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

Rockin Saturday Run

& Then Drinks!

Latest Weather Forecast
For Saturday Afternoon:

Sunny around 68 Degrees

That's great weather for running and for
getting together afterwards for a
few drinks. Beautiful sunny skies
in the afternoon will make for great
viewing of the lake and park as we run.

Join us and have fun!

Our group is a group of runners,
of all running abilities,
who work in mostly professional fields.


Great people to run
and to socialize with.

When:

Saturday, April 16th, at 5:45 PM


I'll be wearing a black DGA
(Director's Guild of America)
baseball hat and I have blond hair.

That's me in the center: 



For The Run:

It's best to travel light, or wear
a backpack and throw your stuff in there.

The less you bring with you
the better it is. 

For New Members and
First Time Group Runners:


It's cool if you're not a speedy runner.
You won't be the only one.  Plus, after just your 
first run with us, the run and the running tips, 
will make you a better and faster runner.

Guaranteed.

After we run, and get our
metabolism into high gear,

We'll go to a nearby cool bar
and reward ourselves for our efforts.  

They have good food and drinks
that are inexpensive and tasty.

At every run, we always get a whole
bunch of new members who join us
and add to the mix.

If you have any questions
Shoot me a message.


It's going to be a fun.

See you on Saturday!

Marcello
(Organizer)

& Then Drinks!


Don't miss the fun

Join us on Saturday 

April 16th..

results.description:
Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle while guests arrive.  Once everyone has checked-in you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.


OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: SpeedMeeting-  Singles Ages 37-52

OUR METHOD:

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
We will be learning and exploring the Tensegrity Practices developed by Carlos Castaneda. The practice is mainly focused on the Magical Passes – modernized forms of body movements which open us to our energetic core, giving us vitality and physical prowess, concentration and purpose, overall wellbeing of body, mind, emotions and spirit, and enhanced awareness.

Open to all levels. Please wear comfortable clothing. No street shoes are allowed in the studio.

Contribution: $10.00

Contact: [masked] or[masked]

We look forward to joining you in the transformative work of this practice!

"The only way of talking about it is to say that intent is intended with the eyes. I know that it is so. Yet, just like you, I can't pinpoint what it is I know. Sorcerers resolve this particular difficulty by accepting something extremely obvious: human beings are infinitely more complex and mysterious than our wildest fantasies. All I can say is that the eyes do it. I don't know how, but they do it. They summon intent with something indefinable that they have, something in their shine. Sorcerers say that intent is experienced with the eyes, not with the reason."

- Carlos Castaneda in The Power of Silence

On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

results.description:
-posted by Jennifer G.-


*****NOTE ABOUT FINDING UUCSR: If you haven't been there before, finding the entrance drive on Shelter Rock Road can be a little tricky. White gates mark the driveway. I've missed it sometimes, because traffic goes fast along Shelter Rock Road. Be prepared to slow down.  For complete directions, see this page: http://www.uucsr.org/discover/getting-to-shelter-rock/Follow the driveway to the main parking lot. Come through the main entrance doors, head to the right past the Social Hall into the Art Gallery.*****

Join VLI for this Saturday night potluck dinner + presentation at the UU Congregation at Shelter Rock!

You are welcome to attend either or both parts. Details below.  

Thanks to our host, UUCSR's Green Sanctuary Committee, you won't need to bring your own dinnerware to this event. Washable plates and utensils will be provided.

6:00 — Doors open

6:15 - 7:00 — Potluck dinner

7:00 - 8:00 — Carnism presentation

What to bring for the potluck: 

• vegan food to share (enough for 8 people)  If you or your guests aren't sure what vegan means, please give them guidance about how to veganize a recipe. Scroll down for guidance notes. 

• recipe and/or list of ingredients 


• serving utensil  (No need to bring your own dinnerware to this event.)

About the presentation:

“Why We Love Dogs, Eat Pigs, and Wear Cows: An Introduction to Carnism” — Jennifer Greene explains carnism, the invisible belief system that shapes our perception of the meat and animal products we eat, so that we love some animals and eat others without knowing why. Carnism is sustained by complex, hidden social and psychological mechanisms, and it is most harmful when unrecognized.

Using powerful imagery and the thought-provoking analyses developed by psychologist Dr. Melanie Joy, Jennifer elucidates how, although unjust belief systems (racism, sexism, ableism, etc.) all are unique, the mentality that enables such systems is strikingly similar. When unnoticed, these “isms” can cause us to act against our core values, our own interests, and the interests of others. By illuminating carnism, this presentation helps us become more empowered citizens and more active social witnesses. Audiences appreciate the accessible, engaging and levelheaded approach, regardless of their dietary choices.

Parental/guardian discretion is advised for younger attendees.

Jennifer Greene is a sociologist who holds a master's degree from the University of Michigan and graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Rice University. She is especially interested in social justice and human-animal relationships.  In addition to her work with Beyond Carnism, Jennifer is also founder of Vegan Long Island Meetup, collaborator with the Coalition for Healthy School Food, author of two food-education curricula, and an active volunteer with Citizens’ Climate Lobby.

Jennifer's presentation is based on the award-winning book by social psychologist Dr. Melanie Joy, founder and president of Beyond Carnism. Both she and Dr. Joy have given this critically acclaimed carnism presentation in the U.S. and internationally.


Guidance for vegan potluck:

Vegan food = food that isn’t from animals. When preparing a vegan recipe, avoid these animal products:

1. Meat—this includes meat from chickens, turkeys, pigs, cows, fish, and other sea creatures; beef or chicken stock, gelatin, lard.

2. Dairy—this includes animal-sourced butter/ghee, milk, cream, yogurt, cheese. There are vegan versions of all these. Be aware that some products marketed as "veggie" or "soy cheese" or "lactose-free" still contain casein, the milk protein.  (Look for "vegan" or the V symbol on the packaging if you're not sure.) Using chocolate in baking? Check the packaging to confirm it's dairy-free. 

3. Egg—there are numerous ways to substitute for eggs: http://www.swansonvitamins.com/blog/kaitlins-blog/egg-substitutes

(What about honey? Honeybees are insects and insects are animals, though science is still learning about insect sentience. To err on the side of caution, use maple syrup or Bee-Free Honee, a honey substitute made from apples, in place of honey.)

results.name: VLI Meetup: Potluck dinner + "Intro to Carnism" w/Jennifer Greene (Manhasset)

results.description:
Join SWITxBOARD @Techfugees and @AfterSpringFilm for an event focused on innovation and refugee livelihoods on April 16th. RSVP HERE.

Coinciding with the Premiere of After Spring at the Tribeca Film Festival, IPA USA is pleased to invite you to a launch party, discussion, and networking event. We're thrilled to welcome Kilian Kleinschmidt, Chairman and Founder of IPA, who is featured prominently in the film and will share his thoughts on refugee livelihoods, migration, and innovative approaches to humanitarian relief.


Kilian and Charles Lee, founder of the Za'atari Taekwondo Academy featured in the film, will give remarks. Additional guests to be announced. Proceeds will go toward furthering IPA's work with under-resourced populations worldwide, and to the Za'atari Taekwondo Academy providing stability and hope for Syrian refugee kids.

This is a great opportunity to meet others working at the intersection of technology, humanitarian relief and development. Tickets $25 at the door only if capacity alows, so register early!

Note that the film will not be shown at the event. Tickets to Tribeca Film Festival screenings of After Spring can be purchased here. (UPDATE: Tickets to TFF screenings sold out in six minutes! Additional screenings will likely take place in the future, details to come.)
results.name: SWITxBOARD and IPA USA Launch Party in partnership with Techfugees

results.description:
STARTING: on the steps of Brooklyn Borough President building, we will walk down Atlantic Avenue to Brooklyn Bridge Park and catch the sunset then head over the Brooklyn Bridge at night for spectacular views of the city. Check out the photos from the last time we did this walk. We had an amazing time! 

WHEN: The meeting time is 6 pm. We will hang out and get to know each other for 20 minutes before we head out on this amazing walk. If you are late event 1 minute you will miss us and the group will not wait. 

WHAT TO EXPECT: Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend/non-awkward and the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people.  

SUBWAY: As you can see from this link, there are tons of subway station stops encompassing this meetup location. The N/R Court Street stop, the 2/3 Borough Hall stop, the 4/5 Borough Hall stop, and the A/C/F Jay Street stop. 

DISTANCE: From point A to B is a little over 3 miles.

PACE: The pace of this walk will be a casual stroll. 

RAIN DATE: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call. 

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

Hello Sisters!

During our meet up last month many if you expressed an interest in mediation and learning the ins and outs of it. 

Well with that interest as inspiration, this will be the topic for April's Meet Up.

Meditation 101:

Benefits & oh did I say benefits

Different ways and techniques to get into a meditative state

We will actually be doing a 20 minute beginner's meditation 

Experiences during meditation and any Q & A's

This meet up will be geared to beginning meditators, BUT if you are experienced or already have a practice in place, please join us as your presence here will lift all of us and support those learning and beginning to incorporate this amazing practice into their lives.

We always have such a lovely time and I just ask you to continue to bring your open hearts and minds to our gathering.

All the best, Big Hug and look forward to meeting/seeing you in April!

Zina
