results.description:
A few months ago I had a few Dutch guests come over for dinner and they brought me a Dutch cookbook. At first I was skeptical, some of the recipes sounded a little bland or too sausage-like, but wow I have been blown away by the recipes in this book so much that I now feel inspired to share a dish with you guys. 

So as you might have guessed the theme of this dinner is "Dutch". To participate you must be willing to bring at least one Dutch dish to share. If you are need some help coming up with some ideas I have included some Dutch recipe links below. Feel free to use any or come up with your own. 

http://www.holland.com/global/tourism/holland-information/dutch-recipes.htm


http://www.thedutchtable.com


http://dutchfood.about.com/od/aboutdutchcooking/u/TraditionalDutchFood.htm


Please also contribute something to drink if you wish to drink with us.


This is a potluck dinner so you should bring your dishes prepared but you can do finishing touches in the apartment. 

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event. 

The fine print: 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of April 2nd.  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.
results.how_to_find_us: Additional Details Will Be Sent To Those Attending
results.name: A Dutch Dinner Party- Potluck

results.description:
Hi everyone!  I am so looking forward to a fun dinner out with you all tomorrow! As you know, were originally set to visit Enthaice! Unfortunately, the restaurant realized last minute that we are too large of a party for them to accommodate, and they could not guarantee a spot for us! So, let''s party around the corner at Leng Thai on Broadway! We have a reservation under "Lindsay" at 7:00pm. Please try to be on time and we look forward to having a great  time! Thank you! 

Howard insists that there's no acceptable or "Howard approved" Thai food in Astoria. I say he's wrong. And Howard is out of town, so let's enjoy some Thai food!  Please join me at Enthaice in Astoria! Looking forward to a fun evening out! 

A few reminders: 


• If your plans change for the evening, please update your RSVP with enough lead time for me to change our reservation. 

• If you can, please bring cash, because it makes it easier paying the bill. I'm not sure if the restaurant will let us have individual checks, but will certainly ask.

• Please show up on time.
results.name: Dinner: Leng Thai

Every Saturday from 7-11 p.m. Social Dance Party at Ventura Dance Center, Closter NJ
Spacious, Stylish, Super comfortable dance studio in Closter New Jersey.
Walden interiors have helped us to create a very special space in art-deco style. Especially for this new ballroom we have ordered light fixtures from France. So, the crystals make gorgeous light effect.
Occupancy is 177 people . Our ballroom is 4000 sqf, we have state of art sound system, 2 changing rooms, 2 restrooms, dance store, new furniture, free WIFI and free parking.

Ladies and gentlemen !!! Welcome to our social party!!! Welcome to our gorgeous ballroom dance studio!!!

“Dust your shoes off and come dance with us !” . You will see New Jersey isn’t boring . Great atmosphere , amazing lightening , lovely dance music , gorgeous ballroom, light snacks and happy people around you .

Every Saturday from 7p.m – 11 p.m. 
Entry fee is $15 per person

results.description: The East Village has always been one of my favorite areas to go on a bar crawl. This area is tightly packed with dark cozy dive bars. And if we work up an appetite there is lots of options for cheap food in the area. We will start at Bull McCabe's a fun Irish pub that has been there since the 90s. Our most likely second stop will be Grassroots across the street known for their popcorn and jukebox. I will post updates here in the comments section until 8 pm.

results.description:
Hey Student Leaders!

This is our 2nd networking event for Student Leaders in North New Jersey! The purpose for this event is to create connections between different student leaders in the north Jersey area. Think of this event as a similar networking event the SGA or the office Student Life hosts in your university. The difference between this event and the networking event in your university is that we'll have different student leaders from different universities at this event.

This event will be ran in an unconference style. Overall, what this means is that we will have discussion based sessions where you guys (Student Leaders) will bring the topics you would like to talk about, and we'll all give our opinions, suggestions, and comments on the topic.  Sample topics would be the following:

1. How to publicize for an event

2. How to recruit new members

3. How to deal with a lazy Eboard member

4. How to effectively train new eboard members

  Get me?

In the education field, they have these unconference events where different educators come together to gain and share knowledge about any topics regarding education; they are called edcamps. We are essentially using that same model, but we'll focus on topics that relate to student-ran organizations. Check out the video below to get an idea of what an unconference event looks like.

  Edcamp Video

Agenda for the event

Welcome (Mingle over light refreshments) 7:00pm

Introduction of Inspimind (Network of College Student Leaders) 7:15pm

Student Leaders Ice Breaker 7:25pm

Edcamp Video 7:35pm

Edcamp (Student Leader version) 7:40pm

Closing remarks 8:40pm

9:00pm Adjournment

Registration for event  (Click here to register to attend the event!)

Questions? Send me a message!

-Wilfredo Betance Jr
results.name: College Student Leader networking

results.description:
Attn:  Group reservations are closed for this spectacle!  

Pour tous les niveaux - for all levels !

Great news... The legendary conductor William Christie and his acclaimed early music ensemble Les Arts Florissants are coming to NYC again to perform LES FETES VENITIENNES - a courtly 1710 opera-ballet bonbon by composer André Campra, famed successor to composer Jean-Baptiste Lully. Running time: 3 hours with intermission.

                    In French with English subtitles.

As a group (10 minimum) we are getting a 20% discount. 


The ticket price is $36 (instead of $45) + BAM order and facility fees which comes to a total of $40 per ticket. Balcony seating. No refund / no changes.

Please send me your check, made out to cash, to arrive at my address by December 18th latest. 

I am sending my address to all who have RSVPd Yes!

Additional information regarding driving there, meeting, etc... will be posted at a later time.


 “Les Fêtes vénitiennes,” a courtly 1710 opera-ballet. The performance will mark the United States premiere of the production, which was first given this winter at the Opéra Comique as part of its 300th anniversary. The piece, which weaves song, dance and spectacle in a carnival atmosphere, promises to be a highlight of the ensemble’s 38th season.

You don't want to miss this French spectacular baroque event.  Un spectacle extraordinaire à ne pas manquer.

                         Inscrivez-vous maintenant !

                VIVE NOTRE GROUPE, IL EST GENIAL !
results.name: SPECTACLE EXCEPTIONNEL - LES FETES VENITIENNES

results.description:
FaceBook page: https://www.facebook.com/events/792043894232787/


SWING REMIX


SATURDAY APRIL 16th, 2016


5,000 Jazz Assassins


DJ Heather Flock

Our second Dance Party of our SPRING season will feature for their very first time appearing with us - The 5,000 Jazz Assassins. The Five Thousand Jazz Assassins have looked into the past and found something new. Riverboat Pop is a contemporary album set in the modern world that pays homage to the music of another time. This motley group of Brooklyn musicians have brought to life a batch of songs that were written almost a century ago. They’ve found a way to relate the music of the Twenties to the world around them.

PRE-DANCE WORKSHOPS

6:30 – Redirecting Momentum Fun figures for social dancing (Adv Basic and up)


Redirecting Momentum: Fun figures for social dancing. Description: Heather will teach some basic 6 and 8 count lindy hop figures that use compression and alternate handholds to add some zip to your social dancing.


Heather Flock

7:30 – The 3 Elements of Lindy Hop Workshop (Intermediate)


What makes Lindy Hop, Lindy Hop? There has to be three elements to be Lindy Hop.... The Swingout Lindy Hop Charleston Breakaway improvisations. In this class you get to use all three in a fun pattern in order to broaden your variety of moves!


Roddy Caravella

DANCE TIMELINE


7:30 General Admission Doors Open


7:45 BEGINNER Dance Lesson (FREE with dance admission)


8:30 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


10:45 Dance Performances, Announcements, Give Aways


11:00 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING


1:00AM END


All Ages

Tickets: $16 early bird (Thursday before event) / $18 Door


*specialty dance workshops extra

PROGRAM:
DEBUSSY Clair de Lune (from Ocean’s 11 & Ocean’s 13)
PUCCINI O Mio Babbino Caro (from A Room With a View)
MORRICONE Love Theme (from Cinema Paradiso), Gabriel’s Oboe (from The Mission)
CORELLI  Concerto Grosso No. 8 “Christmas” (from Master and Commander)                                                                                              MAHLER Adagietto from Symphony N. 5 (from Death in Venice)
ROTA Dances (from Il Gattopardo/The Leopard)

Chamber Orchestra of New York returns to AUPAC with a festive concert featuring music from the movies. The orchestra’s program will feature music from Ennio Morricone's Cinema Paradiso, on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the American release of the film, and Gabriel's Oboe from the film The Mission. The evening will also include works featured in films such as Debussy's Clair de Lune (from Oceans 11), Puccini's O Mio Babbino Caro (from Room with a View), Corelli's Christmas Concerto (from Master and Commander), Mahler's Adagietto (from Death in Venice), and Dances (from The Leopard).


PERFORMERS: 


Salvatore Di Vittorio, conductor

LOCATION: Adelphi Performing Arts Center. Only 45 minutes away from Penn Station on the LIRR Hemstead Line to Nassau Blvd. http://aupac.adelphi.edu/about-the-center/directions/

TICKETS: Varies $35 - $40 (Student/Senior discounts available)
http://aupac.adelphi.edu/newsevent/chamber-orchestra-of-new-york-2/

PROMO CODE: CONY2016 (for 25% off any priced ticket)

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

This event features the best elements of aMatch Live Event, Speed Dating and an Ice Breaker Night.  Join over 150 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.  We will be at St. Pat's Bar and Grill in the Heart of Midtown that features 2 floors of a cozy, casual, comfortable and relaxed atmosphere so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.  We will have games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a fun, friendly and flirty way.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials all night

-3 separate Ice Breaker games with prizes

-Music played at conversational levels.  Music is all in the background.  There will be no dancing (unless you want to!)

Can I come alone?Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.

Dress code: No need for jackets or cocktail dresses but Keep it neat.

Admission: $20 at the door.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several other Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be much more people attending than what you see on this particular RSVP list.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Singles, Mix, Match & Mingle Party! NYCs Most Organized and Fun Singles Event!

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance
Blue: 90’s / 2K / Hip-Hop

Check in Location: Overlook Bar 225 East 44th St, New York, NY 10017
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: Overlook Bar

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
100 Limited Tickets

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.
results.name: Underground Party – Subway Tour!

Join 100+ members already prepaid for this fun singles party. Mix and mingle with other single Meetup members and find your match! It's a great way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people in a friendly & flirty way. The atmosphere is casual & relaxed so you can interact with others without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. 

*GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Apr-16-2016_at_0800PM

*PREPAY ONLY ($15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer) No tix sold at door. 

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

group.name: Fun Things To Do For NYC Singles

results.description:
NO COVER. NEW FRIENDS. FREE COMEDIANS.


Enjoy some of the hottest standup in New York City area –all for the price of FREE! This show will feature a mix of up and coming talent, as well as established, professional talent…that’d normally cost a pretty penny to see.


Doors Open: 7:30pm
Show Starts: 8ish (though you can arrive late, no problemo)
Show Ends: 9:30pmish (then time to shmooze and make new friends and commiserate about our favorite comedians. You love Louis CK too? No way! )

No cover. Two item min. but the owner has been kind enough to hook us up with happy hour food and drink pricing. It's Saturday night in NYC and you'll drink and eat on the cheap fo' sho'. Bring a date. Brings friends. Come alone. Either way, you'll have a great time and and see some really great comics! Don't believe me?... Checkout these reviews from recent meetup attendees:

"Last night was a great first experience. Good comedy... and some wonderful conversation. Looking forward to the next time :)"

"Went by myself but had a great time meeting new ppl..would come back anytime:)"

"Good time... Looking forward to more comedy shows from ya'all!!!"

"I had a great time! Everyone was friendly so going by yourself is okay- you will meet people!"

"It was pretty cool. Would totally go again"

Here's highlights from recent New York Comedy Fans meetups:

http://vimeo.com/114251313

https://vimeo.com/102021699

results.description:
Join 100+ members already prepaid for this fun singles party. Mix and mingle with other single Meetup members and find your match! It's a great way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people in a friendly & flirty way. The atmosphere is casual & relaxed so you can interact with others without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

results.description:
I attended my first Quiet Clubbing Underground Party - NYC Subway Tour on March 12th and I had an amazing time! It was THE MOST FUN I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE (yes, seriously!) and I will be attending each and every one of them till death do I part. I highly recommend checking it out. There's another one coming up on April 16th. Details below. You can see a bunch of pics and videos I took from that event here. 

Get tickets here, but do not wait too long. #1 there's a limited amount of tickets and #2 The price goes up as event day draws nearer. 

This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night. With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers. It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music: 
Green: Top 40's/ Dance 
Blue: 90's / 2K / Hip-Hop 

Check in Location: 
OVERLOOK BAR 225 East 44th Street 
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm 

Special Notes: 
Age Restriction:  21+ 
100 Limited Tickets 

What you need: 
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones) 

How it works:  
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling  in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member. 

Get tickets here: http://quietevents.electrostub.com/event.cfm?key=YW658U7oXE&cart&showTimingID=162864

Your Organizer Beau will be there. Call or text upon your arrival at[masked] 

We are going to have SO MUCH FUN!!!!!

This is the actual video from the event I went to 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lf-J0PPkr80&feature=youtu.be&utm_campaign=website&utm_source=sendgrid.com&utm_medium=email

I cannot stress enough how much fun these things are. Date Walking is fun. Quiet Clubbing Underground Party Experience is 100x more fun!!!
results.name: Quiet Clubbing Underground Party Experience!

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

group.name: The North Jersey Singles Meetup Group

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

Come join us for a night of fun!  250+ dancers (both singles and couples) are expected!  Great international dance music, including: ballroom, Latin, hustle, and contemporary dance music.  

Bar on premises (affordable drinks)

Parking lot on premises

Valet parking is also available

results.name: Dance Social this Saturday!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

results.description:
Step back in time to one of the most spectacular meals of the 19th Century! (At a much more affordable price.)

Becky Diamond, author of The Thousand Dollar Dinner and Victoria Flexner of Edible History in partnership with Vicky Miller of VinoCity Events and Chef Jay Reifel, recreate The Thousand Dollar Dinner. A dinner so legendary it launched a gastronomic turning point in American cuisine, ushering in the grand banquets of the Gilded Age and putting the United States on the international culinary map. 

Travel with us to 1851, as 30 of the wealthiest New Yorkers and Philadelphians gathered at Philadelphia’s renowned Parkinson’s restaurant for a show-stopping 17-course feast staged over 12 hours. The meal showcased the finest ingredients available, presented in the most elaborate cooking methods of the period, each paired with rare Old World wines. So luxurious were the dinner’s numerous courses that it was dubbed “The Thousand Dollar Dinner” in reference to the impressive grocery list price tag. 

Veteran of the New York City underground supper club scene Chef Jay Reifel will execute seven of the banquets original courses in period presentation and style. Diners can expect to be dazzled with dishes like Potage a la Reine, Vol-au-vent à la Financière, Sorbets au vin de Tokia and Agneau a la Diamond. Each course will be paired with Old World wines, curated by Vicki Miller of VinoCity Events, who will explain each pairing.Becky Diamond and host Victoria Flexner will walk diners through this spectacular meal, diving into the history of the period on the 165-year anniversary of the original dinner. 

Dinner to take place at Café Ghia at 8pm Saturday, April 16th 2016. Tickets are $120 each and available for purchase here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-thousand-dollar-dinner-tickets-23112217264


Hope to see you at the table, Cheers!
results.name: Historical Dining - The Thousand Dollar Dinner!

I SAID I WILL  RESCHEDULE WHEN THEY GIVE MY FRIEND TONY ANOTHER DATE AND THEY DID. So now lets see and listen to my My friend Tony's band The Generation Gap. will be at Joyce's Tavern and we will be going there to check them out on Saturday April 16th, 2016 ( which you know that Tony and I reconnected on Facebook approx 5 yrs ago. We both know each other from Brooklyn. ) Therefore,let's meet at Joyce's Tavern at 8:30p.m..The music starts @ 10 p.m.- 1 a.m.  You can grab a bit to eat over there, ( This is my first time going to Joyce's Tavern. I am a Vegetarian though , and I am also a Animal Activists. I also have  a mouth to spread the news about Animal Cruelty in everything,) However, Check out everything about Generation Gap & Joyce's Tavern on their websites below

If this is your first time hearing the Generation Gap well check out their website below, and you can listen to them on there.

You will see when you get there.  Bring your Friends too.

BTW even though I don't need to make reservations I would still like to know who is coming or not. So if you respond with Yes (which I do hope that you will. I have people from my Facebook page that are coming also.), so please do confirm that you are definitely going to be there. I wouldn't want to be there and no one shows up. I even give out my cell# to those who do confirm that they are definitely coming. It makes it easier on both of us. So please use it. You can also find the Meetup's App in Google Play (I have it on mine through that one) & the Appstore for those who have the IPhone.

I JUST LEFT A MESSAGE ON THE MESSENGER, TO THOSE WHO SAID THEY ARE COMING. YOU KNOW RESPONDED YES. PLEASE DO RESPOND TO THE MESSAGE TO CONFIRM IT. FOR ELSE I WON'T COUNT YOU IN. IT'S RIGHT ON TOP RIGHT SIDE. I AM LOOKING FORWARD TO MEETING YOU ALL. 

Generation Gap's Website.

Joyce's Tavern's Website.

results.description:
https://www.facebook.com/events/994684807286582/

Paradigm Second Edition is here!


A Global Bass oriented party in the heart of Brooklyn!! A party focused on blending and pushing the boundaries of Global Bass: Trappy trilly twerky funky tropical, Moombah, Zouk, Kuduro, Miami Bass, Jersey Club, Grime / UK Funky, Brega, Funkero...and list grows with every new dj set we do. It grows as we engage in uncovering our own identity within the style, our own source. Lineup: 

**Dope Tendencies**
This kid has been making waves. Dope Tendencies is the alias of 24 year old Daniel Maurrasse out of NY. Known for his Moombah, Trap, and Dubstep. He has been taking the scene by storm with heavy hitting bangers, that retain a sense of melody. Playing shows all over the US, and receiving support from one of his inspirations (I see you Munchi). Dope Tendencies is about to blow! Enjoy the fireworks!

https://soundcloud.com/dopetendencies


 **FXWRK**
Also, things are getting sexier as we're bringing guest DJ Coral Foxworth (FXWRK), who is a nyc based producer/dj and member of KUNQ collective. She makes ethereal bass music with soulful rnB vocals, atmospheric chords, intricate trap percussion and rolling 808s. FXWRK has played around nyc & the east coast, at parties like iBomba & Fake Accent, & has worked with artists like Cakes Da Killa, Bbymutha, False Witness & Kilbourne. -Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/fxwrk
FB: https://www.facebook.com/fxwrk/?pnref=lhc 

**Rasta-4 Eyes**
Ukrainian-born deep American South-raised DJ / Producer Rasta 4-Eyes. His sets are steeped in new global culture hybrids with acoustic instrument / MC accompaniment. From the obscene to the sacred. Soul, Funk, Afrobeat, Instrumental Hip-Hop, Roots Reggae / new and old Dub, Twerk / Trap, Gypsy / Indian / Arabic, Tropical Bass, EDM Bass. https://soundcloud.com/rasta_four_eyes 

**Vermilion Bird**
Argentinian native producer/DJ based in Brooklyn, NY. Her music has been featured on Generation Bass, Moombah+ and others. Her sound is characterized by global/tropical influences mixed with creative, melodic twists. In the last few years she has been involved in the NYC electronic music scene as well as in the international Moombahton and Global Bass movements. https://soundcloud.com/vermilionbirdofficial
https://www.facebook.com/VermilionBirdOfficial/?ref=hl Visuals by N8tronic (Warper Party)
21+
$8 at the Door
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be inside :)

results.description:
*****ADDITIONAL CAPACITY*****

Since my original email, due to popular demand, the theater has moved the movie into a larger auditorium.  This means seats are once again available.  The show we'll be attending is:  SATURDAY, APRIL 16 at 10:00 pm at the Metrograph Theater (metrograph.com).  This is located on the LES, not Williamsburg.  You need to buy your own ticket ($15). Once you do, notify me along with your seat # and I'll add you to the "attending" list.  It looks like there's the most availability around rows I, J, K..from seats 8 to 12.  You may want to look there first.

Before the movie, we'll meet up at Barrio Chino (253 Broome Street) at 7:30 pm. It's a few blocks from the theater and then walk over from there.  If you just want to join us for some drinks and socializing, feel free to join us!

About the movie:

The documentary "Los Sures" is a documentary on South Williamsburg.

"Thirty years ago, South Williamsburg was known as “Los Sures,” a place imbued with vibrant life, a community of close-knit Puerto Rican and Dominican families living amidst everyday economic struggle. Today, with the neighborhood fully gentrified, it feels vital to remember this lost world, and Diego Echeverria’s essential documentary, shot in the early eighties on 16mm, brings it all back to life, through the eyes of five different residents. Rediscovered in 2007, the film has become a cornerstone program of the Williamsburg arts nonprofit UnionDocs, which not only restored the film but in 2010 began the “Living Los Sures” historical memory project, an expansive documentary project about the Southside of Williamsburg, Brooklyn."

It will also be preceded by this:


Of Memory & Los Sures (2011) is a hybrid animated documentary film directed and produced by Andrew Parsons & Laurie Sumiye featuring oral histories of longtime residents of Los Sures. Voices of longtime residents are juxtaposed with images suggesting a recently disappearing past. The film weaves their stories, reflecting unique glimpses into collective memory of a place undergoing rapid changes. Through explorations of urban space, the film unearths fragments of history and culture, and recreates those memories through video, photography, archival documents, and animation.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet for a drink and a taco or 2 at Barrio Chino at 7:30 pm.
results.name: EXTRA SEATS ADDED - "Los Sures" Documentary on South Williamsburg

venue.name: Great Hunger Memorial

results.description:
The Great Saw Mill River Clean-Up in Westchester County, which is coordinated by The Saw Mill River Coalition/Groundwork Hudson Valley and local cleanup leaders is part of a large and ongoing community improvement project.

Be part of the group of volunteers (families, civic and youth groups, businesses) to join or lead cleanup crews, bagging tons of trash from streets, parks and streams, and connecting with neighbors and the outdoors. It’s fun, practical, meaningful, and easy. You gather some friends and we provide the bags and other treats to help you go for it! You do your cleanup, leave the bags for the local highway department, and report your cleanup results to SMRC.

Groups will be working at various sites from 10:00am-1:00pm. Click here to see a map of clean-up sites. Groundwork Hudson Valley will be providing tools, bags, and gloves. Please wear clothing appropriate for working outfdoors and close-toes shoes!

Not sure where your help is needed? We can help. Check out the Online Map of Potential Cleanup Sites showing various locations throughout the watershed. You can join in at one of the spots listed or let us know where you would like to clean up. To get started, register here or view more information on our website at: http://www.sawmillrivercoalition.org/

results.description:
Please join us for Food and World Music night at Farafina cafe and Lounge with great food, music and dance powered by Panla "A Taste of Africa Event Series and sponsored by African Soul Jam and friends.

Party all night - 2 floors of excitement. DJ Universe, DJ Fols, DJ SM. Afrobeats, Coupe Decale, Soca, Reggae and more - connect with a cultured and outgoing crowd.

Time: 10pm - until
Come early for dinner and party all night. Top African chefs. Dinner is served till midnight - Suya and other light food served all night.

Admission is free until midnight. $10 after midnight. 

NOTE: We are expecting friends from other networks. So be there on time to connect with other meetup members. We don't reserve table all night. If you can't find the meetup table, text Seyi (212)[masked])  or Akin (646) 643 6261. For more information please email Akin at [masked]

At Panla we love bringing people together in the name of African food, music and culture - join us at Farafina and come connect, dance and meet new friends.

Please feel free to share with friends.

results.description:
Two of the most venerable names in the horror field, author Stephen King and director George A. Romero, present this anthology of original twisted tales inspired by the E.C. horror comics of the 50's and 60's (themselves a more direct basis for the popular Tales from the Crypt TV series). The five stories are framed within the pages of a comic book which a boy's insensitive father has thrown in the garbage. The first tale, "Father's Day," features a zombie patriarch returning to claim his Father's Day cake; "The Lonesome Death of Jordy Verrill" stars King himself as a slack-jawed yokel whose discovery of a radioactive meteorite turns him into a walking weed; "Something to Tide You Over" presents a deadly-serious Leslie Nielsen as a cuckolded husband who plans an elaborate seaside revenge; "The Crate" unleashes its ferocious man-eating contents on the enemies of a meek college professor; and "They're Creeping Up On You" pits obsessively-clean billionaire E.G. Marshall against a swarm of cockroaches in his sterile penthouse. The chapters are uniformly creative, filmed in garish comic-book colors, and Tom Savini's makeup effects are quite memorable (particularly the monster from "The Crate"), though the campy treatment does become exhausting after two hours' runtime. The final segment is the most impressive, thanks to Marshall's over-the-top performance, though the planned scope of the cockroach invasion was drastically reduced (no doubt due to budget constraints).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hDTpWFGnBek

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans, 

Formula One heads to China for round three of the 2016 championship. The Shanghai International Circuit is a 3.39 mile, 16 corner clockwise track with a mix of blind and technical turn complexes of both increasing and decreasing radii, medium to high speed corners, two long straights, and a tight hairpin immediately following a long overtaking zone.

The big news for this race is that the old qualifying format from last year will return after much dismay and controversy around the 2016 elimination format. 

In the current standings we have Nico Rosberg with his two wins claiming the top spot in the Drivers’ championship with 50 points, Lewis Hamilton in second with 33 points and Daniel Ricciardo in third with 24 points. In the Constructors’ battle Mercedes leads with 83 points, Ferrari in second with 33 points and Red Bull in third with 30 points.

TIRE ALLOCATION - Pirelli has elected the P Zero white medium, yellow soft and red supersoft tires. The drivers can choose how many of each they would like to use throughout the weekend, but are required to use at least two different compounds for the race.

DRS ZONES - The Shanghai International Circuit will feature two DRS zones - the back straight (between turns 13 and 14) and the start-finish straight (between turns 16 and 1) each with individual detection points.

So can Nico Rosberg continue his winning streak? Or will Lewis Hamilton get his first win of the year? Or can Ferrari overcome reliability issues with a victory? If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Chinese Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 2:00AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 1:30AM EDT.

We hope to see you SATURDAY NIGHT!
results.name: 2016 Chinese Grand Prix

results.description:
Join Transportation Alternatives and Bike the Boros: Staten Island! TA takes you through New York City's greenest and most serene borough like never before. 

(Please note, I am not leading a group during this ride, just posting the information. if anyone would like to lead a BBC group, let me know!)

On the 35-mile route, you'll ride along the north shore of Staten Island, then cut through the middle of the island to the eastern shore for spectacular views of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge and New York Harbor. 

Opt for the 55-mile ride and you'll coast through Heartland Village, New Springville and Lighthouse Hill before reaching Historic Richmond Town. Don't forget to check out the beautiful ocean vistas at Great Kills Park. There's so much to see.

Cost: $35 for Staten Island Residents, $50 General Registration, $150 "Very Important Pedaler" Registration

Register at: https://secure.transalt.org/site/TRR/CY2016/General/62420635?pg=ptype&fr_id=1310

Time, location, route and finish festival details will be provided upon registration.
results.name: Bike the Boros: Staten Island with Transportation Alternatives

results.description:
We'd like to invite you all to attend "Hack Over Passover," a storytelling hack-day on Sunday April 17th, 2016 in NYC.

Location: New York Code and Design Academy
Duration: 12 Hours
Ticket Price: $10 (Buy at https://hackoverpassover.splashthat.com)
Who should attend? Designers/Developers/UI/UX Researchers


"In a world where most communication happens through digital media, how can we enhance our ability to tell community stories and share our collective memories?"


Whether you build a hack to improve the way we share podcasts with friends, develop VR games, or build tools to enable collaboration on screenplays, we'd like to explore the processes by which people "sit around a campfire and share stories" in the digital age.

Grab your tickets on our SplashThat page now! https://hackoverpassover.splashthat.com

To provide quality, leavened and kosher nourishment, we're still actively looking for sponsors to feature at our event. If you are interested or know of any potential partners please email us at [masked].


We look forward to seeing you there!

Donny + Oren Kanner & The #HackOverPassover Team

results.description:
Some of us requested me to post day Hike at Delaware Water Gap. So we can meet our gang that spend a night at Mohican Outdoor Center, NJ.  We will try to meet them at Sun Fish Pond.


The hike will be about 10 miles long, depending on the actual route we pick. There are some steeper climbs on the trails - expect 1,500-2,000 ft elevation gain along the trail. This is a really nice, though strenuous hike, which can be done even by physically fit beginners.


The number of participants is limited only by the number of cars we have to carpool. Please sign up on the waiting list and once we have a car spot for you I'll move you to the "yes" column.

We'll be leaving NYC at around 8 a.m. on Sunday. Cars meet at Dunnfield Creek first parking lot, 70 miles west of NYC on I-80. The parking lot is just before the last exit on I-80 in NJ. The time to meet at the parking lot is around 9:15 a.m. After the hike we might stop for dinner in Stroudsburg, PA. Expect coming back to NYC after 7:30 p.m.

The cost will be moderate - gas & toll money to the drivers ($15-$20 per person) and dinner after the hike. Please bring enough cash with you to pay both the gas money and the dinner!

Regarding gear, be aware that it may be a hot, sunny day, but we can also get some rain. Bring at minimum 2 liters of water. Also bring a lunch snack, sunblock, sunglasses, layers of clothes and rain gear. The trail can be hiked in any good shoes, though boots are preferred.

I will bring a map, a compass, and a first aid kit. Post a comment or e-mail me if you have any questions.

Chaiyut

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Book to discuss: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change by Stephen R. Covey

Review from Amazon.com:

The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People: Powerful Lessons in Personal Change was a groundbreaker when it was first published in 1990, and it continues to be a business bestseller with more than 10 million copies sold. Stephen Covey, an internationally respected leadership authority, realizes that true success encompasses a balance of personal and professional effectiveness, so this book is a manual for performing better in both arenas. His anecdotes are as frequently from family situations as from business challenges. Before you can adopt the seven habits, you'll need to accomplish what Covey calls a "paradigm shift"--a change in perception and interpretation of how the world works. Covey takes you through this change, which affects how you perceive and act regarding productivity, time management, positive thinking, developing your "proactive muscles" (acting with initiative rather than reacting), and much more. This isn't a quick-tips-start-tomorrow kind of book. The concepts are sometimes intricate, and you'll want to study this book, not skim it. When you finish, you'll probably have Post-it notes or hand-written annotations in every chapter, and you'll feel like you've taken a powerful seminar by Covey.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
Join us for the fourth hike in the September 11th National Memorial Trail Series, this time in another near loop with the Morris Canal Greenway from Jersey City to Newark! We've intentionally planned this hike to coincide with the Cherry Blossom Festival!

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/250859_10150203792566777_2150918_n.jpg?oh=8178505983ee76dcc257534e522a0cdc&oe=5754D6AF

CHANGE OF PLANS FOR MEETING!
We will NOW be meeting by Hudson Mall at the Forhundredforty Shopping Center, behind the Burger King near Party City and Sleepy's. There is a lot of parking here, and it is directly on the Morris Canal. This actually will improve the hike.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/228301_10150203821306777_366927_n.jpg?oh=2b0470eb066851fe8789fe032bddef9a&oe=5794883E

By meeting at the new location, we now have the ability to grab something for breakfast at Burger King or other near things before moving on. The meeting point simplifies the entire transportation aspect a lot, because a frequent bus leaves Penn Station and returns to this point almost exactly. There is also the option of walking the four miles back at the end. It's also a very retro-Burger King.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/1452246_10154208646101777_2438141027150074368_n.jpg?oh=60f11e4637f86113a6ebdb34c72d6bca&oe=5771EA8A

We'll start by hiking up to Lincoln Park. Because we won't be doing the Journal Square section as previously though, we'll make a circuit around the park and explore a little bit of the sights.


The first bit of the hike is also the Liberty-Water Gap Trail. We'll start by following pleasant back streets to Lincoln Park.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/246823_10150203820411777_694391_n.jpg?oh=6a646f4333135339bd3548f63c751243&oe=578EF152

The trail then follows lovely walkways through Lincoln Park on it's way to the west, toward the Hackensack River. This little bit at the start will be repeating a short section of the previous hike 911 Hike.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/247646_10150203820156777_5245745_n.jpg?oh=464e88a346351ba550a1f74fcbe52cff&oe=578AEEC6

Again, we will not be doing the Journal Square section; it was going to be a repeat anyway since we walked that section of the designated trail last time. Instead, this time we'll take that extra time to explore some of the side paths on the estuaries of the Hackensack River, which is quite beautiful.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/12717894_10154208645671777_915502405637322229_n.jpg?oh=53223a47223939fce05d49139e96a92c&oe=57B4683F

Next, we reach Truck Routes 1 and 9. The trail temporarily follows this route because it has a pedestrian walkway necessary for us to continue across the Hackensack and Passaic Rivers.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/248103_10150203819281777_5608080_n.jpg?oh=cdb7080e9ab390e303e6b0b5ba976aa4&oe=57532B88

Once we reach the bridge, we also reach the former Morris Canal. The canal crossed these rivers at tide water with locks at either end immediately parallel with the highways.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash2/v/t1.0-9/229061_10150203819056777_6040124_n.jpg?oh=bb03d6678ddc534ad4d6ba49055f426f&oe=574C8550

The bridges afford us good views of the Pulaski Skyway and both rivers. Not many use the bridges for pedestrian purposes, which makes it something really interesting.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfl1/v/t1.0-9/247086_10150203818131777_5296233_n.jpg?oh=011cc680860f90786a237c5c0399eed2&oe=575061B5

Along the swath of land in Kearny, the Morris Canal was directly south of the highway. At one point, a retention pond has been built at the former canal prism which sort of emulates the canal. Some say this is the last watered section of the canal east of Bloomfield.

https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtl1/v/t1.0-9/11110881_902423849794154_6847583084257724341_n.jpg?oh=769b41dab85531ba0aa0a08c83d40548&oe=577308CC

Next, we enter Newark and pass through the Ironbound district. Here, we will continue to follow rather closely the former route of the Morris Canal, parallel with the Passaic River, some of which has newly developed parks we may walk through. We then pass through Penn Station once again, also the route of the canal, and reach Military Park, an old park set up early on in Newark's history.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/246629_10150203809656777_4427525_n.jpg?oh=86907d22f32ca9eaa016b84181a87c7e&oe=574F7006

This was the formal end of the Lenape Trail, part of the 911 Trail and Liberty Water Gap Trail. The train then heads north to Washington Park on street.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/249347_10150203807881777_7358809_n.jpg?oh=c1d70cb0a8300443ced51b57a9ed4f82&oe=578BF2F1

After this point, the trail follows some pleasant back streets through part of Newark, then cuts to the north into beautiful Branch Brook Park.  The cherry blossoms will hopefully be in full bloom at the time we arrive.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash2/v/t1.0-9/228134_10150203801451777_4193637_n.jpg?oh=34fc6ae20a3727a675e97ab79c7bf652&oe=574ED2BD

Either way, the park is a long green swath, and stunningly beautiful. The yellow blazed Lenape Trail leads along much of the east side of the park, but switches to west as it heads to the north.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/228780_10150203802831777_2127162_n.jpg?oh=3365c70da84630715e9236522db6eac5&oe=5788AE5B

We will continue through the park on Lenape Trail all the way to the very northernmost side.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/229330_10150203794916777_6817529_n.jpg?oh=c1b5efe5af928e37617ec87003368ffa&oe=57501090

Once we reach the north end, we will turn to the left, and then start heading back down the other side of Branch Brook Park, sometimes on streets, sometimes just barely into the park, tracing the old canal route.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/248700_10150203793066777_7646332_n.jpg?oh=acb296a62c28d2bec1b487276c4a8fa9&oe=574C8CD3

On the west side of the park, much of the former canal is now dug out, and is the route of the Newark Subway. We'll parallel it as best we can heading south. We may check out the stations, because they are adorned with Morris Canal themed art.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/281404_10150270718106777_231186_n.jpg?oh=0e262b1eb7a309a40e8182ef94252fe0&oe=5794E668

We'll continue on streets as we reach the lower end of Branch Brook Park again, tracing where the canal used to go.  The canal actually used to go under buildings, and we will see how the subway of today utilizes this as well.


We will also pass the historic site of Morris Canal's Inclined Plane #12 East. The canal implemented scotch turbine driven inclined planes making it the greatest climber of the world's canals, an innovation much vanished in modern day.

This is sure to be a lovely hike, and the beginning of transition from urban to suburban for the trail. As we continue west on future hikes in this series, there will be less road walking, more woods, etc. The canal series and 911 Trail series also split at this point, and cross paths several times in future hikes.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/984271_854950241208182_444280320400534886_n.jpg?oh=d6d56a52b37c0355fde12093d9cb1046&oe=574B8F40

From Plane 12, which is Raymond Blvd and the former canal route, we will simply head back to Newark Penn Station, from which point frequent buses head back across Truck Rt 1 and 9 to get back to the shopping center where we started. Otherwise, if there is time and interest, we will walk the four mile distance back to the cars over the bridges, which might afford us good sunset views if we use the opposite side walkway.


https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/11165302_902424829794056_4958736183416679957_n.jpg?oh=43e8bb2d20ad7a944a5f8ed536d64182&oe=57B36E33

For any further info on this one, feel free to contact me at[masked] 8374.

M'ke

The recent cold weather has kinda diminished the tree blossoms as shown here:

venue.name: Manhattan Whitehall Terminal (aka Staten Island Ferry Terminal)

results.description:
This ride will take us across the four East River bridges that connect Brooklyn and Queens with Manhattan.

We'll start our 19.4-mile ride at 9:30 am from the Battery Park Ferry Terminal, at the bottom of Manhattan. That will get us to the end of our four-bridge tour in time for a lunch stop at South Street Seaport.

The ride kicks off with a short pedal up the Hudson River Greenway to the North Cove Yacht Harbor in Battery Park City. We'll have great views of the new Freedom Tower and the Winter Garden Atrium. Then we'll cross Manhattan on Warren Street to City Hall before beginning our ride across the Brooklyn Bridge.

From the Brooklyn Bridge we'll have fantastic views of South Street Seaport and the Wall Street area to the south and the Manhattan and Williamsburg Bridges to the north. Once back on the ground we'll make a few short turns through Brooklyn's DUMBO area (Down Under the Manhattan Bridge Overpass) before beginning our assent of the Manhattan Bridge. Now we get a great view of the historic Brooklyn Bridge to the south and a closer view of the Williamsburg Bridge to the north.

We'll land back in Manhattan on Canal Street, on the borderline of Chinatown and Little Italy. After a few more turns through Manhattan's lower east side we'll reach Delancey Street and start our way across the bike-friendly Williamsburg Bridge. From the steel cantilever structure of the Williamsburg Bridge we'll have our first view of the Queensboro Bridge to the north and the Brooklyn Navy Yard to the south.

We'll land in Williamsburg, Brooklyn... the start of a three mile pedal that will take us through the ethnically rich Bushwick and Greenpoint sections. Then we'll cross over the Maspeth Creek and Long Island Expressway into Queens on the smaller Pulaski Bridge. After another 1.5-mile ride we'll arrive at Queens Boulevard and can begin our climb of the Queensboro Bridge.

The Queensboro Bridge,with its five spans, is the longest of the four East River bridges we'll cross. That's because it crosses the residential area of Roosevelt Island before arriving in Manhattan. The official name of the bridge, as of 2010, is the Ed Koch Bridge. The bridge is also known as the 59th Street Bridge, the name shared by the famous Simon and Garfunkel tune (a.k.a. Feelin' Groovy).

From the steel cantilever structure of the Queensboro bridge we'll have a view of Roosevelt Island, the Triborough Bridge, and the Hell Gate Bridge to the north. We'll look south to see the United Nations and southwest at the spectacular skyline of midtown Manhattan. We'll land in Manhattan on 60th Street, the bottom edge of the exclusive upper east side. From there we'll find our way to 2nd Avenue where we'll head south to 34th street.

The rest of our southbound ride will be on the Manhattan Waterfront Greenway, where we'll have spectacular views as we pass back under three of the four East River bridges.

We'll take our lunch break at South Street Seaport before riding the last mile back to Battery Park.

The whole ride, with stoppage time, should be about 3-1/2 hours. It's well suited for road, hybrid, or mountain bikes. Most of the ride will be flat, but there will be four significant climbs (each with at least a 150 foot vertical rise). That means this is probably not a good ride for first-time riders. That said, the bridge climbs are gradual but long, so even with a little bit of experience, novice riders will be fine with the bridge climbs.

Here's a link to the ride map:  http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/fullscreen/367001071/

Join us for this scenic ride over four remarkable bridges.

TERMS OF PARTICIPATION

By registering and participating in this Big Weekend Adventures event, you acknowledge that you have read and agree to the following statement:

I understand that bicycling involves certain dangers and risks which I am prepared to assume for myself and all children accompanying me. I will abide by all traffic laws and regulations and agree to bicycle in a safe and prudent manner. In addition, I agree to waive all claims which I, or any member of my family, or my heirs, executors or assigns, may have against Big Weekend Adventures or its agents for damages or injury sustained as the result of participating in a Big Weekend Adventures activity.

For a list of safety guidelines, visit: www.bigweekendadventures.com/terms-of-participation/

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time. With the cold weather, we will get rolling on time so that our runners don't get too cold waiting for others to show. 

If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

With spring rapidly approaching, it is time to make our plans to go to the Cherry Blossom Festival at Branch Brook Park in Newark NJ. The CHERRY BLOSSOM display is the largest in the UNITED STATES outside of Washington,D.C. The beauty of the Newark CHERRY BLOSSOMS is comparable to that of the trees around the Tidal Basin in Washington D.C. The Newark Festival is several days long. This is a huge park that spans two cities. Driving through the park can be magical during this time of year. Look forward to seeing you all. We will meet at the Sunoco station[masked]nd st at 945am kicksatnds up 10 am sharp.Then we will take the Verrazano Bridge thru Staten Island to the Goethals Bridge to the Turnpike N to Exit 13A to 81N to US 1-9N to NJ 21N to Grafton Ave to Branch Brook Park Drive. We will also be going out to lunch at the famous TOPS Diner seen on Diners Drives in and Dives

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
Embracing the Light of Truth, Transparency, and Authenticity.

Every year at the full moon in Taurus, a rare cosmological alignment happen allowing light and the latest dispensation from God to descend into the crown chakra of the planet. The geometric center of the crown chakra of the planet is the Wesak valley in Tibet. Each year, pilgrims come to this location to attune, receive, and celebrate this festival of light, love, and ascendance. During that period, any groups that gather and attune to this holy place will equally receive the same benefits.

Wesak this year will happen on Thursday April 21st, 2016. We will celebrate this festival of enlightenment in New York City on April 17th, 2016 at The Simple Studios 134 West 29th St, NYC 10001 from 10:00am to 6:00pm. 

The festival continues the following weekend at the newly opened Gaiaville Retreat Center in the Catskill Mountains of New York on April 23rd, and 24th, 2016 at 14439 State Highway 97, Long Eddy, NY 12760 from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Early bird special for all three days until April 8th, 2016: $252.00. 

There will be a FREE open house on April 22nd, 2016 from 9:00am to 7:30pm at the Gaiaville Retreat Center in the Catskill Mountains of New York with morning and afternoon meditations and a Celestial Fire Ceremony at 6:00pm. 

Please follow the link below for the details and to sign up for the event or call [masked]-0685.

Please Join us.

www.iammonad.com/wesak-2016-celebration-in-new-york-city-and-the-catskill-mtns-of-new-york

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree
results.name: Meditate

results.description:
Hey Peeps, We're going to do a beginner ride at Blue Mountain - its probably the best place to ride in our area.

If the ride is full, RSVP anyway to get on the waiting list.  We may open it up to more riders or have a second group if we get more guides.

Blue Mountain  is train accessible - You can take Metro North from Grand Central Station to the Peekskill, NY train station. It is then about a 20 minute bike ride to The parking lot at Blue Mountain where we will meet. The ride will start at 1:15 pm so you will need to catch the 8:43 AM train out of Grand Central to arrive at Peekskill at 9:48 AM. You will also need to buy a bike pass at Grand Central (I think its about $5) so you can take your bike on the train.  


We'll ride for about an hour or two.  Those that want to continue can, the rest can head back to catch he train home. 

See this map to find the route you can take from the train station to the Blue Mountain parking lot and trail head:

Also feel free to contact other members to see if you can catch a ride. If you're driving, when you post your RSVP please let us know if you are willing to give others a ride.

Check out this link to see what we define as "beginner."
http://www.meetup.com/NYCMTB/messages/boards/thread/10167809

Check out this link to see what you should bring/wear for the ride:http://www.meetup.com/NYCMTB/messages/boards/thread/48856143

You will need a fat tire mountain bike in good working condition for this ride. This means that the chain is well lubricated, the gears shift well without skipping and you have good working breaks - trust me you will need them. Full suspension mountain bikes are best, but hardtails are also okay. 


We ride as a group, no one gets left behind and there are no egos about riding - its all just about having a good time.

Waiver...

**By signing up for a meetup, I agree to the following: Mountain Biking can be dangerous and cause serious bodily injury or even possibly death. The organizers of this group and it's members will not be held responsible for the actions of any participant at any event. Each rider attends an event at their own risk and is solely responsible for any damage to their equipment or themselves.


YOU MUST FULLY UNDERSTAND THAT MOUNTAIN BIKING INVOLVES RISKS AND DANGERS OF SERIOUS BODILY INJURY, INCLUDING PERMANENT DISABILITY, PARALYSIS, AND DEATH. FULLY ACCEPT AND ASSUME ALL SUCH RISKS AND ALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR LOSSES, COSTS, AND DAMAGES. HEREBY RELEASE FROM ALL LIABILITY, CLAIMS, DEMANDS, LOSSES, OR DAMAGES ON MY ACCOUNT CAUSED OR ALLEGED TO BE CAUSED IN WHOLE OR IN PART BY THE MEMBERS OF THIS GROUP.


I HAVE READ THIS AGREEMENT, I FULLY UNDERSTAND ITS TERMS, UNDERSTAND THAT I HAVE GIVEN UP SUBSTANTIAL RIGHTS BY ATTENDING AND HAVE ATTEND FREELY AND WITHOUT INDUCEMENT OR ASSURANCE OF ANY NATURE AND INTEND IT TO BE A COMPLETE AND UNCONDITIONAL RELEASE OF ALL LIABILITY TO THE GREATEST EXTENT ALLOWED BY LAW

-Peter
results.name: Beginner ride at Blue Mountain in Peekskill, NY (Rescheduled for Sunday 4/17)

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR SOME EXPLORATORY SINGLETRACK MOUNTAIN BIKING AT STEWART STATE FOREST (Multiple Use Area).

I've been here a number of times but am still learning the trails. Expect some minor route finding as we explore this wonderful venue! You can find the maps below to print out and bring with you.


Please arrive by 10:30am at the Ridge Road North Parking Area to allow time to prep your bike and gear so that we may depart promptly by 10:45am.

Stewart State Forest offers many trails to choose from with beginner to intermediate skill levels depending which trails you take. It's a huge riding area approximately 10 miles in diameter of nothing but trails. Though single-track is more advanced in nature than riding carriage roads, this park has some of the more "beginner - friendly" single-track in the area.

Distance: 15-20 miles


Estimated Bike Time: 3-4 hours

Difficulty: Advanced Beginner/Intermediate - rolling hills with rocks, roots, gravel and leaves


Current Weather Forecast: Mostly Sunny with a high of 73 degrees!


MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike

• Bicycle Helmet

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, Bug Spray, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

WHERE TO MEET?

Ridge Road North Parking Area


RELATED MAPS:

Stewart State Forest[masked]x17.jpg

Stewart State Forest[masked]x36.jpg


MORE INFO:

http://www.dec.ny.gov/lands/50095.html


FEEL FREE TO JOIN US AFTERWARDS FOR SOME FOOD AND DRINKS AT

Machu Picchu Peruvian Restaurant

301 Broadway - Newburgh, New York

http://machupicchurest.com/

Phone:[masked]

Mon: 11:00am - 10:00pm
Tues: CLOSED
Wed: 11:00am - 10:00pm
Thurs: 11:00am - 10:00pm
Fri: 11:00am - 10:00pm
Sat: 12:00pm - 10:00pm
Sun: 12:00pm - 10:00pm

Family owned and operated since 1990, Machu Picchu Peruvian Restaurant first opened it’s doors to invite the community to experience the culinary richness of Peru. Since then, we have been specializing in authentic Peruvian flavors and ingredients, aiming to capture the complexity of this great cuisine through a diverse menu.

Whether it’s our Ceviches or Pollo a la Brasa (Peruvian Rotisserie Chicken), Machu Picchu is considered the “Best Peruvian Food in the Hudson Valley.”

Located within the East End Historic District of Newburgh, New York, our family welcomes you to share in our culture and experience this food first hand at our restaurant!


**HEAVY RAIN WILL CANCEL THIS EVENT**


NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The NYC Hiking & Outdoor Adventure Group does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
You're not still hibernating are you??  if you are, now is the time to dust off the gear, pump up the tires and break away from the winter blues.  Spring is finally here and this Sunday couldn't be a better day to kick off the riding season.  Let us use this time to reconnect with old friends, and make new friends.   We'll take it nice and easy so you can get comfortable again.  

Please RSVP for the ride.  We are starting a bit later to take advantage of the sun's warmth.  This will be a casual ride around the usual scenic roads north of Westchester.  I will be riding my cruiser but you can bring whatever you want as long as it contains no more than 3 wheels!  :)

The route will be simple but scenic and entertaining.  Round trip is about 115 miles only.  Not a long day.  Just a few hours of riding.  

* Bronx Pkwy North to 22 North

* 35 West to 202 to Bear Mtn pkwy

* Quick stop for gas at Bear Mtn 

* 9W to 218 Storm King Hwy

* Stop for a quick lunch at Village Pizzeria

* Head back via 218, 9W to 202, Taconic/Sprain Pkwy (quickest way back)

Meet at 10:30am.  

KSU @ 11:00am (that's Kick Stands Up for the unfamiliar)

Let's have fun!  see you then :)

IT IS SPRING!  YES?!  Come nourish and watch your new year seedling/wish grow with yummy energizing practice each week!
