results.description:
***NOTE*** This group is currently full and we are not accepting any new players.


INTRODUCTION:

Until just days ago, most members of our party were blissfully unaware of the Keys of Power and their creator, the Aramago. The suddenly, they were tasked with ferrying one of these mysterious items and the courier carrying it to somewhere it would be safe.


They learned quickly that numerous were those with interest in what they possessed. Their mission was immediately fraught with danger and the party was running for its life. Then, just as quickly as it had started, it was over. The adventurers became separated from many in their group including Melrick, the wizard that had hired them to protect his journey.


They passed through an alien realm they soon became certain was the dark realm known as the Shadowfell. Their stay on the plane of shadow was short-lived, however, and they soon found themselves back in the natural world. But they were very far from home and a number of their comrades were not with them.


What will Robin, Meline, Trask, Poe, Zyle, and Malako do now? Do they try to reunite with their mates and finish their mission? If so, how will they go about finding them? These are questions they all ponder and one of their number does so along with the realization that they’ve arrived at his homeland. A homeland he had left nearly two decades prior swearing to only return when he had made his fortune.


BACKGROUND:

“In Pursuit of Power" is one of two, biweekly games I am running in the Central Jersey D&D MeetUp group under the banner of “Adventures in Azocar”. It meets on the first and third Thursdays of each month. We may also have additional meetings if there’s a fifth Monday in any given month but mostly, this will probably be kept open for make-up games.


I am looking for a group of players willing to commit to the schedule I propose; players whose attendance will not be an issue. These players also need to be ready to be involved in a long-running game. This game will run in parallel with the “Keeper of the Keys” game with my hope being both groups can meet for a massive gaming session every now and again.
results.name: In Pursuit of Power - An Azocar Adventure

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
The weather looks sunny and warm through the weekend and into Monday! Let's do a brisk walk on April 18th from Long Dock Park in Beacon out to Denning's Point, check out the beach, and walk back. Sunset is at 7:40 pm, so bring a headlamp in case we spend some time hanging out on the beach. Denning's Point is a state park which is closed between December 1-March 31 due to it being a popular place for bald eagles to roost. It used to be home to brick factories and remnants of the buildings and bricks can be found there. There are nice views from the beach, as well as from the walk out to Denning's Point along the river.

Distance: ~3 miles round trip


Time: 1-1.5 hours depending on how long we hang out at the beach

Elevation gain:  Minimal

Gear: Headlamp/light as we will be ending near dusk, water if you wish, sneakers/hiking shoes, layers if the temperature/wind warrants

+++

results.description:
NOTE: HUI Central™ is our new name (formerly NUI Central).

6:30PM - 7:00PM - Networking

7:00PM - 8:00PM - Rethinking the UX of IoT with Natural Language Voice Technology


With the explosion of mobile and IoT technology over the past few years, voice has become a primary interaction method for a growing and diverse range of apps and devices.  Accompanying this growth is a shift to a self-service model of voice design and development, enabled by a new host of tools and platforms. Designers, developers, and product owners are finding themselves positioned to build their own cutting-edge natural language interfaces and to learn the disciplines of voice design and development at the same time.

In this discussion, Tanya Kraljic and Adam Emfield of Nuance will share their take on this space by way of their experience researching, designing, and using Nuance’s new developer ecosystem and natural language customization tool, Mix.nlu. They’ll talk through what they've learned from the first wave of developers and designers using the tool and many of the challenges and opportunities faced for the discipline as this space grows.


Tanya Kraljic, Principal Interaction and Dialog Designer

Tanya Kraljic is a principal interaction and dialog designer for Nuance Communications. She leads a multidisciplinary team of designers and UX researchers in the strategy and design of speech experiences in mobile, wearable, in-home, and other emerging technologies. Tanya has helped clients from startups to Fortune 100 companies navigate the spaces of natural language technology, conversational design, and predictive intelligence. Prior to joining Nuance, Tanya earned a PhD in psycholinguistics, the psychology of language use.


Adam Emfield, Senior User Experience Researcher

Adam Emfield is the senior user experience researcher at Nuance Communications. He has a broad background studying and working in human factors psychology, industrial engineering, and computer science. He spends most of his time with developers and designers to help test and validate new prototypes, as well as make sure that existing products are improved through iterative user testing.


8:00PM - 8:30PM - Hang Out - Network

Share this event:   @HUICentral   

http://bit.ly/HUICen-33

Join HUI Central.com

IMPORTANT : If you come to the event and you are not registered on the Meetup site by 1:00PM on the day of the Meetup, you will have to wait to the side to see if there's room to accommodate you. If so, you will have to pay $10 to be admitted, else you will have to leave.

CODE OF CONDUCT

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Humanized User Interface, HUI, and HUI Central are trademarks of ScreenPlay InterActive Corp.
results.name: Rethinking the UX of IoT with Natural Language Voice Technology

As user experience has gained traction and respect inside companies and product development teams, UX people are increasingly participating in more and more strategic conversations. This makes sense: UX people have both unique insight into users and customers as well as a design-driven toolkit for expressing problems and finding solutions.


In this talk, Josh will explore the connection between strategy, execution, and user experience work in Agile contexts. Come learn how you can frame a simple, clear strategy of surprising power, and use that strategy to connect each level of your organization around a guiding vision.

Presenter 

Josh Seiden is a designer, author and coach. He is the co-author of Lean UX and the forthcoming book Sense and Respond.

Agenda:

7:00 - 8:30 - Presentation and Discussion.

results.description:
We have a special treat for the group this week - one of the best conversion rate experts in the industry will be joining us to teach you how to monetize your traffic for both large and small businesses and how to maximize the money you make.


Topic

Make More With Your Traffic - The Unsexy Science Of Wringing More Profit Out Of Your Audience.


Description

Everybody wants more traffic, and eyeballs on your offer are the lifeblood of any business. But that's only one of the three ways to earn more, and it's not even the easiest. Two things you can do today that don't require virality, keywords, or ad spends: get more people who already see your offer to buy, and charge them more. And I'll show you how.


Teacher Bio - Nathaniel Smith

Hey folks, 

I'm an entrepreneur and marketing consultant. My story is I started my own business in the music niche. To be blunt, I sell drum courses. It's a small and price-sensitive group. So I needed to figure out how to convert them at a much higher rate than the industry average, and convince them to buy something expensive even if they don't have much money to spend. Marketing is applied psychology. It's copywriting - What you write, and CRM - When you write, and to whom. Last year I grew my monthly profits roughly 8x when my list, at best, doubled in size. Now, I help other entrepreneurs do the same.
results.name: How To Make More Money With Your Traffic

results.description:
In this course, we will build an ASP.NET Core application from scratch. Along the way we will learn about middleware, controllers, views, and models. We'll support SQL Server using the Entity Framework and user registration with the Identity Framework. We'll also see novel techniques for working with front end frameworks like Bootstrap and JavaScript libraries like jQuery. By the end of the course, you'll have everything you need to start building applications with the ASP.NET Core framework.

About the Author: Scott has worked on everything from 8-bit embedded devices to large scale web sites during his 15+ years in commercial software development. Since 2001, Scott has focused on server-side and web technologies, like ASP.NET, ASP.NET AJAX, Windows Workflow, Silverlight, and LINQ. Scott is also a speaker at national conferences like VSLive!, as well as code camps and user groups near his hometown of Hagerstown, MD.

Scott has been recognized as a Microsoft MVP since 2005, and has written or co-authored several books on Microsoft technologies. Scott founded the site OdeToCode.com in 2004, and joined Pluralsight in 2007.

results.description:
What better audience to assess the relative pros and cons of (what Thoughtworks’ Martin Fowler terms) the microservices architectural “style” than developers in the fashion capital of the universe—New York City? 

Forget for the moment the academic and theoretical. We’re here to show you the real deal—a live introductory demo of “all things microservices.” We’ll combine open source frameworks and technologies—Docker containers, Vert.x, Wildfly Swarm, Spring Boot, NodeJS, .NET, OpenShift, Kubernetes, and more—live and in person. See for yourself what’s on fire, and what might just be ready for your enterprise. 

Speaker Bio:  Burr Sutter is responsible for Red Hat’s developer experience. Burr is currently an Oracle Java Champion, and was previously president of the Atlanta Java Users Group and founder of the DevNexus conference. Burr has spoken at numerous developer events from Brazil to Beijing and has traveled throughout the US and Europe presenting to developers on numerous topics.


Thanks to our location and food and refreshments sponsor for this month: IPsoft.
results.name: Frameworks and Tools for the Microservices Architectural “Style”

group.name: The New York City Java Meetup Group

results.description:
About the talk:

Just Not Sorry is a gmail plug-in that highlights weak words that undermine people's message. Just Not Sorry was built by Cyrus Innovation, a NYC based Agile consultancy, in under a week. In its first month, 100,000 people downloaded the app and hundreds of news outlets covered the launch.

Tami, who had the idea, and Steve, who built the app will walk through the Lean validation and Agile prioritization they performed leading to the successful launch. They'll also tell you stories about post-launch development in Agile ways.

About the speakers:

Tami, CEO of Cyrus Innovation, leads the Cyrus team to deliver great results for our clients. She focuses on ensuring that Cyrus is a great development partner, guiding clients through tough times and helping them grow. 


She is an experienced product person who has worked with dozens of companies of all sizes to bring their products and services to market. Over the past 10 years, Tami has worked with teams to develop technology solutions on platforms ranging from mainframe systems to modern microservice architectures and iOS. She is a public advocate for Agile development, Lean strategies, and cross team collaboration to accomplish business goals. Prior to joining Cyrus, Tami was a Sr. Product Manager at Pivotal Labs where she consulted with companies on employing best practices to turn good ideas into great products.

Steve is an engineering lead and agile coach at Cyrus Innovation with more than sixteen years of experience in software development, architecture and technology strategy, agile coaching, and team building. He has built successful software systems for a variety of industries, ranging from scientific data management for the Broad Institute to television scheduling software for HBO to telecommunications billing software for Lucent. He specializes in creating user-friendly and maintainable software using Agile, Lean, and XP techniques.
results.name: Case Study: Getting to 100K users in 30 days

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 15 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

* WE DO DIFFERENT PAINTINGS AT EACH EVENT SO IF YOU'VE BEEN TO ONE OF OUR EVENTS BEFORE... HAVE NO FEAR... YOU'LL BE PAINTING SOMETHING NEW!


This event is mostly for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. All ages are welcome to attend.

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/painting-drinks-night-in-nyc-tickets-24688528052


WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

results.description:
Nestled in the cozy Hamilton Park neighborhood of downtown Jersey City is 9th & Coles Tavern, a restaurant and bar with a focus on local food sourcing and vegetarian options.


You could say that 9th & Coles is on a mission. They recently introduced a special all-vegetarian Meatless Mondays menu, and they are aiming to be a 100% vegetarian restaurant by the end of summer. 


The pumpkin soup looks amazing! Of course, we would order it without the honey... ;)


...and check out that beet salad!


While the menu is not always 100% vegan, pro chef Dan Haag will be preparing us an all-vegan menu for our event.


Here is the vegan menu Dan has put together just for us!!  It's a 5 course Prix Fixe menu for $30, with an option to order courses a la carte for $10 each.  The a la carte portions are a little bit bigger. 

As I was organizing this event and speaking with one of the owners, Tony, he was on his way to The Bat Farm, a sanctuary for farmed animals in upstate New York. Owners, Tony and Greg, are vegetarian for the animals and more than a little vegan-curious. All of the produce they use in their restaurant comes from their farm! Tony has been quoted saying, "You don’t know love until you’ve spooned with a pig,” referring to Wattles, a resident of The Bat Farm.

That's a story I'm looking forward to hearing more about! 

This event has a lot of potential to be very impactful as the owners are already such devoted animal lovers and care so much about buying local produce in order to support the community and help the environment. It is our hope that by showing them that there are plenty of vegans and vegetarians in the area and that there is indeed a demand for vegan food, they might consider transitioning all the way to completely vegan by this summer! We can even offer to hold additional events in the future to help them promote their new menu.

Join us in supporting 9th & Coles during their transition to an all-vegetarian restaurant/bar and (hopefully) inspiring them to be 100% vegan eventually! 


Directions: 9th & Coles Tavern is at, well, 9th and Coles in downtown JC. It's about the same distance walk from either Newport or Grove Street PATH stations.

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet us inside the bar, we'll have a "meetup" sign.
results.name: Vegan Dinner at 9th & Coles Tavern

Did you know that New York City's spectacular Hudson River Greenway is part of a longer route of mostly trails and quiet roads that extends from the Canadian border to Maine to Key West in Florida?

Whether you are a touring cyclist or aspireto be, are seeking an alternative to riding cross-country, or enjoy discovering regional and local grenway and trails, the 3,000-mile East Coast Greenway can be the route for you.

Come learn about this route connecting major cities along the Eastern Seaboard a the FREE informational event. Find out about organized group rides as well as tips on where to go on your own.

Whether you're interested in a one-day excursion or a multi-day adventure, the East Coast Greenway has it all.

Monday, April 18, at 6:30PM, at REI SoHo's Community Room, 303 LaFayette St,. Manhattan. Light refreshments will be provided. Sponsored by the New York Committee for the East Coast Greenway, www.greenway.com

Please register so we know how many are coming. Search "East Coast Greenway on Eventbrite.com or type in www.eventbrite.com/e/discover-the-east-coast-greenway-in-new-york-city-tickts[masked]?aff=eac2.

New to meditation or experienced meditators, all are welcome and encouraged to join!  Meditation has been scientifically proven to produce powerful changes in your physiology and in your psychological and emotional wellbeing. And it even deepens your spiritual development.  

We will discover which are the three steps necessary to train the quality of our attention and find ways to practice them in our daily life to shift into a life that is richer and happier.   We will then meditate together following the simple easily followed instructions according to the teachings of Deepak Chopra. 

Event is free and a $10 donation is encouraged.  Please, RSVP because the space is very limited. Try to be on time!  We close the door when the meditation starts. 

If you have any questions or concerns do not hesitate to contact me.

results.description:
P90X LIVE!
Monday April 18 at 630pm at Clove Lakes Park. Meet by the basketball courts by Clove and Victory. 

Workouts are for all fitness levels whether you’re just starting out and this is your very first workout or if you’ve been pushing hard for years. You will sweat, you will work, you... will HATE IT, but YOU’LL LOVE IT!

The workout is approximately one hour long with breaks. Each participant should bring water and a towel. Optional accessories for the workout include a yoga mat and light dumbbells if you have them. We will have some extra equipment on hand but please bring what you have.

It’s a total body workout beginning with cardio, then moving into lower body strength training, then upper body strength training then lastly ending with a core workout all while moving to the beat of some kick ass music!!

So please, come on out and get your sweat on! And spread the word!

PAGE SHARES ARE VERY MUCH APPRECIATED TO HELP SPREAD THE WORD!

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Monday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  This group meets at the dining tables directly in front of the bowling lanes. There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's. We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Monday Night Board Games at Dave & Buster's!

results.description:
Working in the City with  Harmony and Commitment 

We all participate in the 'great work'.  If  our 'inner work' is good then our 'outer work'  will also be  good.  And as  we work on what needs work, we contribute to the 'great work' . For sure, each of us is called to be a part of this 'great work' which takes place  in  relationships, families, communities, neighborhoods, committees, offices or on the job - in short-  wherever we find ourselves contributing to the welfare of one or many.

During this week we will explore the nature of work, the differences between a job and work. We will talk about the inner  work that we  all need to do and how this leads to a life of greater harmony and commitment for ourselves and the society, We will also  discuss and examine how  this combined energy contributes to the welfare of the entire city.

 We will examine the idea that perhaps  there is a connection between the reality of homelessness on our city streets and the 'homelessness' we sometimes feel deep within ourselves!

Each session will take place between 6:30 and 7:30 pm each evening

This workshop is designed and facilitated by Human and Organization Development Specialist and Certified Life Coach, Soror Patricia Downes who will take participants on a transformative journey. 

The workshop will include questionnaires, mini lectures, individual and group exercises, meditations and large group discussions.
results.name: Working in the City with Harmony and Commitment

THE EVENT

*

Classy Spring Social

5:30pm to 9:00pm

Join PBSN at the new Hat Tavern for social networking and for just having fun. You just might meet that special person tonight ... Invite your friends and mix and mingle with many singles from your local area.

Cash bar with a 20% discount on all food (not to be combined with any other promotions). Fantastic Happy Hour: 5:30pm to 7:00pm.

Experiential Workshop / Discussion (optional)
Mars and Venus on a Date

with Janet Gray, B.A., M.A., Educator, Facilitator, & Writer

6:45pm Registration in the lounge
7:45pm one hour plus program in the Wine Room
9:00pm Conversations in the Lounge.

During this one hour plus presentation Jan will explore with us John Gray's 5 stages of dating and how to power up from that first date into a long-lasting, satisfying relationship. This workshop is interactive and welcomes participants to share experiences and best practices.

*

No Reservation is needed.

Singles, Couples, Groups, Guests, Friends and Walk-ins are always welcome.

Membership is not required.

*

PROPER DRESS

Business attire, no jeans or sneakers please..

results.description:
This time, let's do something different and celebrate the arrival of Spring and warm weather with an excursion to New York and dinner at Tavern on Jane, a pub conveniently located in the West Village that is a short (5 to 10 min.) walk from the Christopher or 14th St. Path. The atmosphere here is comfortable and homey and we will have our own cozy room in the back. Tavern on Jane offers classic pub fare as well as a variety of interesting dishes that range from grilled chicken or shrimp pizza to yellowfin tuna tacos to beer battered fish and chips, salads, and a selection of entrees and pastas, plus a full bar with a variety of wines, beers, and mixed drinks. You're sure to find something you like.

This is a joint meetup with my other group, West Village Dynamic Discussions Meetup, so come mingle with the regulars and some new people!

Note : I have to give the restaurant an accurate number of people attending. Any member who RSVP's "Yes" is expected to attend; if you find you cannot make it, please have the courtesy to update your RSVP to "No" as soon as possible. Also, please arrive promptly so that we can get our orders in.
results.how_to_find_us: We will have our own table in the back room
results.name: Springtime Dinner in NY!

venue.address_2: take 1,A,C,E,L, F or V to 14th St.
venue.name: Tavern on Jane

results.description:
Let's do something a little different this month and celebrate the arrival of Spring and warm weather with a festive dinner at Tavern on Jane! This time, there will be no formal group discussion, just fun and friendly mingling with open-ended conversation, and of course, drinks, delicious food, and great company. 

Tavern on Jane is a group favorite in the West Village that offers classic pub fare as well as a variety of interesting dishes that range from grilled chicken or shrimp pizza to yellowfin tuna tacos to beer battered fish and chips, salads, and a selection of entrees and pastas plus a full bar. You're sure to find something you like. The atmosphere is comfortable and homey and we will have our own cozy room in the back!

This is a joint event with Hoboken Once a Month Meetup Group.

Note : Since I have to give the restaurant an idea of the number of people attending, any member who RSVP's "Yes" is expected to show up; if you find you cannot make it, please have the courtesy to update your RSVP to "No" as soon as possible. Also, please arrive promptly so that we can get our orders in.

Looking forward to a great time!!

.

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
We'll meet on the southwest corner of John F. Murray Park (45th Rd. and 11th St.) at 7:00pm for our 4ish mile loop around LIC. 

You can run at your own comfortable and totally non-competitive pace and know that we'll never leave you behind. 

We usually head to the pub for beverages and/or snacks afterward - Bring some cash if you would like to participate in our post-run social time. 

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 5 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. Please be prompt. 

As always, if you have any comments, ideas or suggestions, please let us know!
results.name: Monday Evening 4ish Mile Run

results.description:
One thing is absolutely certain about this year's presidential election: in November, the state of New York will vote for the Democratic candidate. So the election that matters for us is the Democratic primary.

Both Hillary and Bernie want a lot of the same things, as does Obama, but neither Hillary nor Bernie will be able to deliver much more than Obama has without great Democratic majorities in both houses of congress. Both want to:

• give the government more power to break up banks that are too big to fail

• overturn Citizens United and enact campaign finance reform

• expand pre-kindergarten education

• make college more affordable (Hillary “nearly free”, Bernie “free”)

• raise the federal minimum wage (Hillary by 65%, Bernie by 106%)

• raise taxes on the rich, Bernie talking about it more aggressively than Hillary

• ensure 12 weeks of paid family leave and medical leave

Bernie's list of campaign promises is basically a list of what he would like to do if he were a dictator, in complete control of all 3 branches of government.  He particularly appeals to young people who aren't familiar with the sort of compromises that need to be made to get anything done. Hillary is far less unscrupulous about making promises that she knows damn well that she won't be able to keep. Fact checkers find that Hillary has been running the most honest campaign of any major presidential candidate in this election.

Hillary has been a Democratic front-runner for president for a very, very long time, and there has been a whole Republican industry out to smear her for all those years. So they've manufactured a lot of “scandals”, but she has basically come up clean. Worst case, if she screwed up and failed to reinforce Benghazi, who cares? People make mistakes. And no secretary of state before her had used the government's email facility – if she is guilty of violating some regulation (that didn't even exist before she was took office) regarding how secret email was to be handled, it's no big deal.

Bernie won't be able to deliver single-payer health-care, one of his central promises. In 2010, the Democrats had a strong majority in the house and a near filibuster-proof majority in the senate, and they still weren't able to get the “public option”, let alone single-payer. The Democrats are EXTREMELY unlikely to have majorities like that in 2017, so all Bernie's talk of enacting single-payer is out of the question – it's just empty talk. Hillary's plan to defend and expand Obamacare is, realistically, the most that can be hoped for.

What's more, most of the goodies Bernie is promising to give away depend on large tax increases on the rich being passed, and the likelihood of his facing a congress willing to pass those tax increases is remote.

Bernie constantly misrepresents the “bailouts”, making it sound like they were a gift, not a loan, saying that they “cost the taxpayers” money (all the big financial organizations paid back the loans, with a profit for the government, within a few years, if not within a year). He says the the Fed audit he sponsored uncovered “$16 trillion” that was “spent” (“spent” makes it sound like it was never paid back while it was all paid back within a couple of years, and the “$16 trillion” figure was arrived at by accounting sleight-of-hand, in fact the total debt outstanding never amounted to a tenth of that at any point in time). Furthermore, many banks, such as Goldman-Sachs and JP Morgan Chase, were individually solvent and didn't need bailing out. The government felt they needed to bail out all the banks to avoid making any banks look bad, to avoid provoking runs. So the banks were all forced to take the money, with the management of some of them vehemently protesting, and many of them paid the money back, with a profit for the government, immediately when they were permitted to, in June of 2009.

Bernie promises to prosecute the big banks for the sort of illegal activity that caused the 2008 financial crisis. There's a problem with this, in that the financial crisis was not caused by illegal activity by the big banks.  Home buyers lied about their incomes, and mortgage originators pretended to believe them, which was illegal, but neither of those parties were the big banks, and there is no political appetite for prosecuting them. The press has played up talk that the rating agencies had a conflict of interest in that they were paid by the banks whose bonds they were rating, but it's not clear they were fraudulent rather than stupid – if real estate prices had not stopped increasing (and practically nobody in the country anticipated that that they would stop increasing), then when the homeowners failed to make payments, the homes would have been worth more than the loans against them, so that foreclosing on the homes would pay off the loans, and the bonds would not have defaulted. As a result, those bonds would have performed according to their ratings. And even if the rating agencies committed fraud, they are still not the banks. If the banks knew what they were doing all along and defrauded someone else, why was it the banks that lost money? If fraud occurred, the banks were victims of it, not the perpetrators. When being interviewed by the New York Daily News, Bernie was unable to name a specific law that was broken that caused the meltdown. This is much more significant than Sarah Palin not knowing what the “Bush Doctrine” was – Bernie sells himself, pretty much every time he speaks, as an expert on the criminality of the big banks, yet when asked to name the law that was broken, he comes up blank.

------------------------

Bernie consistently shows a poor grasp of economics. One of the worst things about socialists is that they either fail to understand, or just outright reject, the basic laws of supply and demand. So they set wages too high, which eliminates jobs, and set prices too low, which eliminates goods and services. From The Economist last week, describing socialist Venezuela: Visiting a supermarket in Venezuela is like entering Monty Python's cheese-shop sketch. “Do you have any milk?” The shop assistant shakes her head. Sugar? No. Coffee? No. Soap? No. Cornflour? No. Cooking oil? No. Do you in fact have any products that the government deems so essential that it fixes their prices at less than what it costs to make them? No. Bernie wants to:

• set the federal minimum wage too high (discussed below)

• impose a $2 maximum ATM fee (discussed below)

• impose a %15 maximum on credit card interest (discussed below)

Minimum wage: Hillary wants to raise the federal minimum wage to $12 (which is higher, in inflation-adjusted terms, than it has ever been), and leave it to individual states with high costs of living, like New York and California, to set higher state minimum wages, while Bernie wants to set it to $15 everywhere. Bear in mind that the cost of living varies a lot by state, so a $15 minimum wage in Mississippi is would be like a $19.21 minimum wage in New York. The fact that anyone would claim that a $19-equivalent minimum wage would not kill any jobs just boggles the mind. Being underpaid may suck, but being unemployed sucks a lot worse. It is unclear whether Bernie's enthusiasm for a reckless increase in minimum wage stems from his poor grasp of economics, or from the realization that unemployed people are more likely than underpaid people to vote for extremist politicians like himself.

$2 Maximum ATM fee: Most banks provide free ATM access at their own ATM's, but private ATM's of the sort found in convenience stores, gas stations, and shopping malls charge fees. If the fee is greater than $2, that probably reflects the fact that the cost of providing the service in higher than that. Some places will cost more than others. In a high-crime neighborhood, the armored car that stocks the ATM will need more guards to prevent it being robbed. In a rural location, the armored car will have to travel a longer distance to re-stock the ATM. What imposing a $2 limit on ATM fees will do is result in ATM's being unavailable in high-crime or rural locations.

15% Maximum Credit Card Interest: Right now, if you have a good credit record, you can get credit cheaper than that. If your credit is mediocre, or unknown, that means that, as far as the bank can tell, you are likely to fail to repay your debts, and lenders will have to lend to you at higher interest rates to recoup their losses. A 15% cap on credit card interest means that everyone with mediocre credit (or a lack of credit history) will be unable to get new credit cards.
Young people starting out have no credit history. When trying to obtain credit, they are caught in a Catch-22 situation – no one wants to be the first to lend to them. What's more, being young, they haven't had time to save up a “rainy day” fund to boot. A 15% cap on interest means that it will take many years longer (with no rainy day fund) for them to get their first credit cards. And if you have credit cards and lose them in a rough patch, it will take that much longer for you to re-establish yourself again.

-----------------------

Bernie describes high-speed trading as “risky and unproductive”, which is just displaying his economic ignorance. In fact, most high-speed trading, like market-making, is quite beneficial, and not very “risky” at all. The book Flash Boys, by Michael Lewis, describes “front-running”, a form of high-speed trading that is not beneficial (but certainly not “risky”), though many people familiar with high-speed trading doubt that front-running is a serious problem, and if it is a problem, the same book describes ways to deal with it without government intervention.

Bernie claims that the repeal of Glass-Steagall was one of the causes of the financial crisis. According to Ben Bernanke, Obama's Fed chairman: “I don't know why Glass-Steagall became such a poster child for 'deregulation that caused the crisis'. All it did was separate commercial banking from investment banking, and it wasn't the hybrid banks that got into trouble. What's more, Glass-Steagall would have prevented the rescue of Bear Stearns by JP Morgan Chase, and the rescue of Merill Lynch by Bank of America.”. The financial crisis was caused by the fact that hardly anyone was anticipating the crash in real estate prices – deregulation was not the problem.

Bernie says that workers in Mexico and China are paid “pennies per hour” – quite an exaggeration. Actually, the MINIMUM wage everywhere in China (and most workers are getting more than that) is over a dollar an hour. And the average MINIMUM wage in Mexico is over $5 an hour.

Bernie, like a true socialist, is bewildered by the most basic economic realities. His website says “it makes no sense” that auto loans are sometimes at lower interest rates than student debt. Has he never heard of collateral? If someone doesn't make car payments, the bank can repossess the car. If someone doesn't pay on their student loans, does Bernie expect the bank to “repossess their education”???  So student debt is much riskier than auto debt, hence the higher interest rates.  Furthermore, car companies often offer auto loans at ridiculously low interest rates (I've seen 0% advertised), subsidized by charging a higher price for the car, a trick that is generally not employed with student loans.

Bernie says that the assets of the big banks amount to “58% of GDP”, making it sound like they own most of the country, which displays either ignorance, or, more likely, intellectual dishonesty. It's an apples to oranges comparison – assets, being wealth, is a static quantity, while GDP is a flow. “58% of GDP” is actually more like “10% of the wealth of the country”, the wealth of the country being several times GDP.

Bernie voted against the 2008 bailout, which tells us a LOT about him. Had the rest of the senate voted with him and the government failed to intervene, end the financial panic, and prevent runs on banks, the recession would have been far worse. Many banks would have failed, and with them, many other businesses, not just the banks, would have gone under, too. We would have had unemployment over 20%, quite possibly over 30%. A large fraction of the population has no savings and relies on their credit cards for their “rainy day fund”. If Bernie's effort to block the bailouts had been successful and the banks had gone under, those people would have lost their credit cards and found themselves without resources in the mother of all “rainy days” indeed. Why did Bernie vote against the bailout? Because he's a hateful, spiteful man, who hates the banks so very deeply that he will do anything he can to screw them, even if it means destroying the whole damn country in the process.

Sanders is far more offended by wealth than poverty.  We saw by his 2008 vote that he would MUCH rather impoverish the masses than allow an undeserving few to prosper.  In 2008 we faced an emergency which required us to set ideology aside and deal with the problem.  Sanders showed that he lacks the flexibility to do that.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the front, and I'll have a sign on the table.  I look like my picture, plus a mustache.
results.name: Why You Should *NOT* "Feel the Bern" - Host: Bill C.

So the banks were all forced to take the money, with the management of some of them vehemently protesting, and many of them paid the money back, with a profit for the government, immediately when they were permitted to, in June of 2009.

Bernie promises to prosecute the big banks for the sort of illegal activity that caused the 2008 financial crisis. There's a problem with this, in that the financial crisis was not caused by illegal activity by the big banks.  Home buyers lied about their incomes, and mortgage originators pretended to believe them, which was illegal, but neither of those parties were the big banks, and there is no political appetite for prosecuting them. The press has played up talk that the rating agencies had a conflict of interest in that they were paid by the banks whose bonds they were rating, but it's not clear they were fraudulent rather than stupid – if real estate prices had not stopped increasing (and practically nobody in the country anticipated that that they would stop increasing), then when the homeowners failed to make payments, the homes would have been worth more than the loans against them, so that foreclosing on the homes would pay off the loans, and the bonds would not have defaulted. As a result, those bonds would have performed according to their ratings. And even if the rating agencies committed fraud, they are still not the banks. If the banks knew what they were doing all along and defrauded someone else, why was it the banks that lost money? If fraud occurred, the banks were victims of it, not the perpetrators. When being interviewed by the New York Daily News, Bernie was unable to name a specific law that was broken that caused the meltdown. This is much more significant than Sarah Palin not knowing what the “Bush Doctrine” was – Bernie sells himself, pretty much every time he speaks, as an expert on the criminality of the big banks, yet when asked to name the law that was broken, he comes up blank.

------------------------


Bernie consistently shows a poor grasp of economics. One of the worst things about socialists is that they either fail to understand, or just outright reject, the basic laws of supply and demand. So they set wages too high, which eliminates jobs, and set prices too low, which eliminates goods and services. From The Economist last week, describing socialist Venezuela: Visiting a supermarket in Venezuela is like entering Monty Python's cheese-shop sketch. “Do you have any milk?” The shop assistant shakes her head. Sugar? No. Coffee? No. Soap? No. Cornflour? No. Cooking oil? No. Do you in fact have any products that the government deems so essential that it fixes their prices at less than what it costs to make them? No. Bernie wants to:

• set the federal minimum wage too high (discussed below)

• impose a $2 maximum ATM fee (discussed below)

• impose a %15 maximum on credit card interest (discussed below)

Minimum wage: Hillary wants to raise the federal minimum wage to $12 (which is higher, in inflation-adjusted terms, than it has ever been), and leave it to individual states with high costs of living, like New York and California, to set higher state minimum wages, while Bernie wants to set it to $15 everywhere. Bear in mind that the cost of living varies a lot by state, so a $15 minimum wage in Mississippi is would be like a $19.21 minimum wage in New York. The fact that anyone would claim that a $19-equivalent minimum wage would not kill any jobs just boggles the mind. Being underpaid may suck, but being unemployed sucks a lot worse. It is unclear whether Bernie's enthusiasm for a reckless increase in minimum wage stems from his poor grasp of economics, or from the realization that unemployed people are more likely than underpaid people to vote for extremist politicians like himself.

$2 Maximum ATM fee: Most banks provide free ATM access at their own ATM's, but private ATM's of the sort found in convenience stores, gas stations, and shopping malls charge fees. If the fee is greater than $2, that probably reflects the fact that the cost of providing the service in higher than that. Some places will cost more than others. In a high-crime neighborhood, the armored car that stocks the ATM will need more guards to prevent it being robbed. In a rural location, the armored car will have to travel a longer distance to re-stock the ATM. What imposing a $2 limit on ATM fees will do is result in ATM's being unavailable in high-crime or rural locations.

15% Maximum Credit Card Interest: Right now, if you have a good credit record, you can get credit cheaper than that. If your credit is mediocre, or unknown, that means that, as far as the bank can tell, you are likely to fail to repay your debts, and lenders will have to lend to you at higher interest rates to recoup their losses. A 15% cap on credit card interest means that everyone with mediocre credit (or a lack of credit history) will be unable to get new credit cards.
Young people starting out have no credit history. When trying to obtain credit, they are caught in a Catch-22 situation – no one wants to be the first to lend to them. What's more, being young, they haven't had time to save up a “rainy day” fund to boot. A 15% cap on interest means that it will take many years longer (with no rainy day fund) for them to get their first credit cards. And if you have credit cards and lose them in a rough patch, it will take that much longer for you to re-establish yourself again.

-----------------------


Bernie describes high-speed trading as “risky and unproductive”, which is just displaying his economic ignorance. In fact, most high-speed trading, like market-making, is quite beneficial, and not very “risky” at all. The book Flash Boys, by Michael Lewis, describes “front-running”, a form of high-speed trading that is not beneficial (but certainly not “risky”), though many people familiar with high-speed trading doubt that front-running is a serious problem, and if it is a problem, the same book describes ways to deal with it without government intervention.

Bernie claims that the repeal of Glass-Steagall was one of the causes of the financial crisis. According to Ben Bernanke, Obama's Fed chairman: “I don't know why Glass-Steagall became such a poster child for 'deregulation that caused the crisis'. All it did was separate commercial banking from investment banking, and it wasn't the hybrid banks that got into trouble. What's more, Glass-Steagall would have prevented the rescue of Bear Stearns by JP Morgan Chase, and the rescue of Merill Lynch by Bank of America.”. The financial crisis was caused by the fact that hardly anyone was anticipating the crash in real estate prices – deregulation was not the problem.

Bernie says that workers in Mexico and China are paid “pennies per hour” – quite an exaggeration. Actually, the MINIMUM wage everywhere in China (and most workers are getting more than that) is over a dollar an hour. And the average MINIMUM wage in Mexico is over $5 an hour.

Bernie, like a true socialist, is bewildered by the most basic economic realities. His website says “it makes no sense” that auto loans are sometimes at lower interest rates than student debt. Has he never heard of collateral? If someone doesn't make car payments, the bank can repossess the car. If someone doesn't pay on their student loans, does Bernie expect the bank to “repossess their education”???  So student debt is much riskier than auto debt, hence the higher interest rates.  Furthermore, car companies often offer auto loans at ridiculously low interest rates (I've seen 0% advertised), subsidized by charging a higher price for the car, a trick that is generally not employed with student loans.

Bernie says that the assets of the big banks amount to “58% of GDP”, making it sound like they own most of the country, which displays either ignorance, or, more likely, intellectual dishonesty. It's an apples to oranges comparison – assets, being wealth, is a static quantity, while GDP is a flow. “58% of GDP” is actually more like “10% of the wealth of the country”, the wealth of the country being several times GDP.

Bernie voted against the 2008 bailout, which tells us a LOT about him. Had the rest of the senate voted with him and the government failed to intervene, end the financial panic, and prevent runs on banks, the recession would have been far worse. Many banks would have failed, and with them, many other businesses, not just the banks, would have gone under, too. We would have had unemployment over 20%, quite possibly over 30%. A large fraction of the population has no savings and relies on their credit cards for their “rainy day fund”. If Bernie's effort to block the bailouts had been successful and the banks had gone under, those people would have lost their credit cards and found themselves without resources in the mother of all “rainy days” indeed. Why did Bernie vote against the bailout? Because he's a hateful, spiteful man, who hates the banks so very deeply that he will do anything he can to screw them, even if it means destroying the whole damn country in the process.

Sanders is far more offended by wealth than poverty.  We saw by his 2008 vote that he would MUCH rather impoverish the masses than allow an undeserving few to prosper.  In 2008 we faced an emergency which required us to set ideology aside and deal with the problem.  Sanders showed that he lacks the flexibility to do that.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the front, and I'll have a sign on the table.  I look like my picture, plus a mustache.
results.name: Why You Should *NOT* "Feel the Bern"

results.description:
One thing is absolutely certain about this year's presidential election: in November, the state of New York will vote for the Democratic candidate. So the election that matters for us is the Democratic primary.

Both Hillary and Bernie want a lot of the same things, as does Obama, but neither Hillary nor Bernie will be able to deliver much more than Obama has without great Democratic majorities in both houses of congress. Both want to:

• give the government more power to break up banks that are too big to fail

• overturn Citizens United and enact campaign finance reform

• expand pre-kindergarten education

• make college more affordable (Hillary “nearly free”, Bernie “free”)

• raise the federal minimum wage (Hillary by 65%, Bernie by 106%)

• raise taxes on the rich, Bernie talking about it more aggressively than Hillary

• ensure 12 weeks of paid family leave and medical leave

Bernie's list of campaign promises is basically a list of what he would like to do if he were a dictator, in complete control of all 3 branches of government.  He particularly appeals to young people who aren't familiar with the sort of compromises that need to be made to get anything done. Hillary is far less unscrupulous about making promises that she knows damn well that she won't be able to keep. Fact checkers find that Hillary has been running the most honest campaign of any major presidential candidate in this election.

Hillary has been a Democratic front-runner for president for a very, very long time, and there has been a whole Republican industry out to smear her for all those years. So they've manufactured a lot of “scandals”, but she has basically come up clean. Worst case, if she screwed up and failed to reinforce Benghazi, who cares? People make mistakes. And no secretary of state before her had used the government's email facility – if she is guilty of violating some regulation (that didn't even exist before she was took office) regarding how secret email was to be handled, it's no big deal.

Bernie won't be able to deliver single-payer health-care, one of his central promises. In 2010, the Democrats had a strong majority in the house and a near filibuster-proof majority in the senate, and they still weren't able to get the “public option”, let alone single-payer. The Democrats are EXTREMELY unlikely to have majorities like that in 2017, so all Bernie's talk of enacting single-payer is out of the question – it's just empty talk. Hillary's plan to defend and expand Obamacare is, realistically, the most that can be hoped for.

What's more, most of the goodies Bernie is promising to give away depend on large tax increases on the rich being passed, and the likelihood of his facing a congress willing to pass those tax increases is remote.

Bernie constantly misrepresents the “bailouts”, making it sound like they were a gift, not a loan, saying that they “cost the taxpayers” money (all the big financial organizations paid back the loans, with a profit for the government, within a few years, if not within a year). He says the the Fed audit he sponsored uncovered “$16 trillion” that was “spent” (“spent” makes it sound like it was never paid back while it was all paid back within a couple of years, and the “$16 trillion” figure was arrived at by accounting sleight-of-hand, in fact the total debt outstanding never amounting to a tenth of that at any point in time). results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please only YES RSVP if you are coming to the group

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

http://artahack.io/summer-2016/call/index.html&via=art_a_hack"></a><a href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?title=Call%20for%20Participation:%20Summer%202016&u=http://artahack.io/summer-2016/call/index.html">http://artahack.io/summer-2016/call/index.html"></a>Apply to: <a href="mailto:[masked]">[masked]

Deadline: Monday April 18 at midnightArt-A-Hack 2016

Announcing Art-A-Hack™ 3 - a collaborative creation between groups of artists/engineers, designers/makers, or whatever combination arises based on your project proposals.

Previous years of Art-A-Hack included inventions, installations, collaborations, performances, which you can read about in the report, watch in the live-streamed videoor see in the blog.

This year promises more fantastic opportunities!

This year our partner is Integrated Digital Media of theNYU Tandon School of Engineering. Art-A-Hackers will have access to their motion-capture and VR studio and facilities!

Are you interested in taking part? To apply now, please read the Open Call below and send your ideas to[masked]. We really want to work with you!

Make sure you are available to take part on the dates ofJune 11, 18, 25, July 9 and July 15. Send us your ideas, we'll team you up with like-minded souls, and you can blast off into the stratosphere together.

The deadline for applications is Monday April 18 - early applications are appreciated.

Open Call Here's the deal: we will provide space for four Saturdays (10am-6pm) in June and July, equipment, facilitation and advice, and stellar showcase opportunities.

During four Saturdays (June 11, 18, 25 & July 9) we will co-create at ThoughtWorks New York, and NYU Tandon. There will be a pre-event social on the evening of Wednesday, June 8, as well as a well-earned closing party July 15 to present your final work, chat, network and land back on the planet.

How to apply To apply, send your ideas now to [masked]. Describe a project idea you want to try, the technologies you'd like to get into, or the skills you have to contribute.

Please include info on any technical tools you know, or a project proposal you have. If you want to focus on a subject area, or social issue, let us know. Please also confirm that you are available on the dates listed below.

When we receive your applications, we will match you up with others to help you achieve your ambitions.

Each year we group people together around the most compelling proposals. This means your specific idea may not be selected, in which case we will try to find you a team and a project which matches your skills and interests.

This is an ad-hoc process, and we can't always match everybody to teams, but we work hard to create aligned teams and have had great results from the process.

Dates for your calendar Here's a list of scheduled dates to mark off in your calendars. Please make sure if you are going to apply that you are available for all of the listed dates!

April 18 (midnight)— Deadline for applications June 8 (6pm-9pm)— Pre-event Social

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
Agenda


Interactive learning - (Daniel Hsu)

Daniel Hsu is an assistant professor in the Department of Computer Science and a member of the Data Science Institute, both at Columbia University. Previously, he was a postdoc at Microsoft Research New England, and the Departments of Statistics at Rutgers University and the University of Pennsylvania. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from UC San Diego, and a B.S. in Computer Science and Engineering from UC Berkeley. He received a 2014 Yahoo ACE Award, was selected by IEEE Intelligent Systems as one of "AI's 10 to Watch" in 2015, and received a 2016 Sloan Research Fellowship.

Daniel's research interests are in algorithmic statistics, machine learning, and privacy. His work has produced the first computationally efficient algorithms for numerous statistical estimation tasks (including many involving latent variable models such as mixture models, hidden Markov models, and topic models), provided new algorithmic frameworks for tackling interactive machine learning problems, and led to the creation of highly-scalable tools for machine learning applications.

Commodity Machine Learning - (Andreas Mueller)

Recent years have seen a widespread adoption of machine learning in industry and academia, impacting diverse areas from advertisement to personal medicine.  As more and more areas adopt machine learning and data science techniques, the question arises on how much expertise is needed to successfully apply machine learning, data science and statistics.  Not every company can afford a data science team, and getting your PhD in biology, no-one can expect you to have PhD-level expertise in computer science and statistics.

This talk will summarize recent progress in automating machine learning and give an overview of the tools currently available.  It will also point out areas where the ecosystem needs to improve in order to allow a wider access to inference using data science techniques.  Finally we will point out some open problems regarding assumptions, and limitations of what can be automated.

Andreas is an Research Engineer at the NYU Center for Data Science, building open source software for data science.  Previously, he worked as a Machine Learning Scientist at Amazon, developing solutions for computer vision and forecasting problems.  He is one of the core developers of the scikit-learn machine learning library, and has co-maintained it for several years.

His mission is to create open tools to lower the barrier of entry for machine learning applications, promote reproducible science and democratize the access to high-quality machine learning algorithms.


Rapid Q/A 

Social event after: 

The Storehouse - 69 W 23rd St.

See you at the event!

- Rizwan, Maryam, Kishan, Matt & Max

About Rise:


Rise New York is a collaborative co-working community shaping the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co-create,and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. Rise New York also houses a worldclass event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars. Oh, and we leave the front door open for the curious…

Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon
